name: Aca-Sound
mission: Aca-Sound runs sound (speakers, mics, mixing, etc) for MIT's student acapella groups.

name: Acroyoga
mission: At MIT Acroyoga, our mission is to unite the MIT community through the dynamic and joyful practice of acroyoga. We provide regular classes, practice sessions, and events in a safe, welcoming space where acrobatics meets yoga, and everyone meets fun! Join us to explore the blend of strength, balance, and flexibility, and foster mental well-being and healthy communication through this exciting group-oriented activity. Everyone is welcome, and no experience is necessary—let’s fly together!

name: Addir Interfaith Engagement Association
mission: The Purpose of the Addir Interfaith Engagement Association is to promote greater harmony, connection and empathy across the full spectrum of religious, spiritual and philosophical identities within the MIT community and in the world beyond. The word 'addir' is an ancient Sumerian word for bridge, and Addir seeks to build bridges both between individuals who orient around religion differently and between different religious, spiritual and philosophical communities. Addir seeks to promote a council of cooperation, learning, and growth amongst the various religious and secular groups on MIT’s campus. Addir encourages increased understanding of all religious and secular worldviews in the MIT community through an Interfaith Dialogue Fellowship, open events, campaigns and initiatives across campus.

name: Afghans@MIT
mission: Afghans@MIT aims to cultivate a vibrant and inclusive community for Afghan students and those interested in the rich and diverse culture of Afghanistan. The organization is dedicated to celebrating heritage, promoting cultural awareness, and supporting academic and professional growth through networking, mentorship, and meaningful dialogue. A key focus is fostering academic engagement and student-led research and technology initiatives by building connections between MIT students and Afghan and diaspora scholars. Additionally, the group aims to address educational and technological needs by supporting Afghanistan’s academic institutions and innovation ecosystem through knowledge-sharing and collaborative projects. By engaging with the broader MIT community, Afghans@MIT strives to create a platform for cultural exchange, advocacy, and impactful initiatives that contribute to the collective growth of MIT, Afghanistan, and its global diaspora.

name: African Students Association
mission: We aim to provide a learning environment for anything African related; to increase awareness about Africa and Africans among MIT students; showcase the various aspect of the African culture such as ways of life, food, music, and clothing; to assist new MIT members in adjusting to the MIT lifestyle, and to present Africa from the African perspective.

name: Allied Scholars for Animal Protection
mission: Vegan@MIT strives to make the world a better place for human and non-human animals by providing education and events surrounding the vegan, plant-based lifestyle.

name: Alpha Omega  MIT
mission: Our goal is to provide a space for spiritual discussion, introduction, and community to college students/affiliates, focusing specifically on the Bible and  Christianity. We offer students deep connections and support with other interested students, even across universities.

name: American Indian Science and Engineering Society
mission: MIT's AISES chapter supports the mission of the national, nonprofit organization focused on substantially increasing the representation of American Indians, Alaska Natives, Native Hawaiians, Pacific Islanders, First Nations and other indigenous peoples of North America in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) studies and careers.

name: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics MIT Chapter
mission: AIAA is a voice to the undergraduate course 16 department and community, provides sanity and happiness (study breaks/parties), supports student career and education through professional development, and encourages first year students to join the community.

name: American Institute of Chemical Engineers Student Chapter  MIT
mission: Our mission is to support, benefit, and advocate for the chemical engineering undergraduate community at MIT.

name: American Nuclear Society
mission: The purpose of the MIT Student Section of the American Nuclear Society (MIT ANS) is to promote the advancement of nuclear science and engineering as well as related disciplines.

name: American Red Cross Team And Network of MIT
mission: ARCTAN, or the American Red Cross Team And Network, is the official liaison between theAmerican Red Cross and the MIT community. Operating in cooperation with the MassachusettsBay chapter of the American Red Cross, ARCTAN runs blood drives, raises funds, teaches CPRand first aid, and provides volunteers for disaster relief and food pantry activities. ARCTAN isrun by MIT students, and its members are MIT students, staff, alumni and affiliates.

name: American Sign Language and Deaf Culture Club
mission: The purpose of the American Sign Language and Deaf Culture Club is to enable gathering of members of the MIT community with a shared interest in American Sign Language and Deaf Culture

name: Amphibious Achievement
mission: To inspire personal growth and a passion for learning in high schoolers through athletic and academic mentorship and hands-on learningAmphibious Achievement is dedicated to inspiring personal growth and a love for learning in under-resourced high schoolers in the local area. By combining athletic and academic mentorship with hands-on learning across a variety of subjects, Amphibious Achievement aims to bring opportunities to students, with the values of SWAG, determination, commitment, confidence, and we got each other, at its core.

name: Anime Club  MIT
mission: The MIT Anime Club is a non-profit MIT student organization dedicated to increasing the awareness of Japanese animation (anime) on campus.

name: AppDev@MIT
mission: Our mission is to build web and mobile applications with the goal of:1) Serving students, campus groups, and local businesses and organizations.2) Fostering practical skills in software development, product management, design, and marketing.

name: Arab Student Organization
mission: The purpose of the Arab Students’ Organization is to foster an Arab community on campus and give Arab students a space where they can be immersed in their culture as well as have a chance to share it with others in an inclusive way. The ASO strives to build bridges between MIT and the Arab world and provide opportunities for members to grow professionally, socially, and through service to the community.

name: Arabic Debate Club
mission: The MIT Arabic Debate Club is a student group focused on Arabic debate and public speech. We organize training sessions to prepare MIT students to participate in Arabic Debate Competitions throughout the year. The MIT ADC aims to encourage intellectual exchange and good communication in Arabic.

name: Armenian Society  MIT
mission: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology Armenian Society (MITAS) is a club of Armenian students and scholars, which aims at creating a welcoming community to preserve and develop ties with Armenia and the Armenian community in Greater Boston Area. We organize multiple cultural events every semester ranging from casual mixers with Armenian students and community members from MIT and other schools in the area to cultural shows, exhibits and panel discussions.

name: Artificial Intelligence Club at MIT
mission: The Artificial Intelligence Club @ MIT is an organization focused on fostering and promoting machine learning education, projects, and research on the campus of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.Our primary goal is to provide opportunities for students to learn about machine intelligence in a community environment. Our secondary goal is to increase interdepartmental and multi-university interaction relevant to machine intelligence — to bring those interested in machine intelligence closer together.

name: ASHRAE MIT Student Chapter
mission: The purpose of the ASHRAE MIT Student Chapter is exclusively scientific and educational and includes, but is not limited to :a) The advancement of the sciences of heating, refrigerating and air conditioning engineering and related sciences;b) The continuing education of the members and other interested persons in said sciences, through lectures, demonstrations, conferences, and publications;c) The rendition of career guidance to students of the sciences; andd) The encouragement of sound scientific research.

name: Asian American Association
mission: Our missions are:To enrich campus life by contributing to an understanding of the Asian American experience.To foster an understanding of the diversity of Asian cultures.To promote awareness of Asian American issues and concerns.To protect Asian American interests by working as a pan-ethnic group.To provide opportunities for the development of leadership and communication skills.To become a service to the community.To encourage Asian American students to take pride in their heritage and identity.

name: Asian Baptist Student Koinonia
mission: We are Asian Baptist Student Koinonia, a Christian fellowship at MIT composed of students who seek to know and love Jesus Christ through a life shared with Him and each other.

name: Asian Baptist Student Koinonia Graduate Division
mission: Asian Baptist Student Koinonia Graduate Division is a group of graduate students joined together in our Lord Jesus Christ, each having a personal relationship with God, and therefore fellowship, or "koinonia", with each other. We have Bible Studies and other fellowship activities throughout the year to help members grow in their faith and build Christ-centered relationships.

name: Asian Christian Fellowship
mission: We’re seeking to be a family where every student at MIT can experience the transformative love of God, a family that’s intentionally seeking God and investing in one another.

name: Asian Club  MIT
mission: MIT Asian Club and MIT Career Fair (ACF) is an official recruiting event at MIT in spring that aims to establish interactive and efficient conversations between Asia based employers and young talents in the U.S. We recognize the value of a thriving regional market in Asia, and students’ growing demand for direct involvement with professional development there. Using MIT as a platform to connect leaders from wide array of industries with ambitious students at MIT, Harvard, and other U.S. universities in the Northeastern area, we hope that the MIT Asian Club will be a successful platform that propels the professional growth of the students and the future development of participating companies.

name: Asian Dance Team  MIT
mission: The MIT Asian Dance Team (ADT), established in 2009, is a student organization dedicated to promoting and representing Pan-Asian culture and dance, ranging from modern Asian pop to contemporary works.

name: Assassins Guild  MIT
mission: We are the MIT Assassins Guild, the LARP and nerf gun focused club at MIT! Join us to spend your day (or week) having a blast! The purpose of the Guild is to sponsor real-time, real-space roleplaying games known as Assassin Games, and real-time, real-space simulated combat.

name: Assistive Technology Club
mission: Our mission is to make the world more accessible to everyone by building connections within our community and fostering collaborative efforts to create inclusive technology. Through AT@MIT, we introduce students to the fun (and challenging) design space of assistive technology while building connections between community members, engineers, and designers. We hope to inspire participants to pursue projects in the AT space in the future.

name: Association of Computational Science and Engineering Students
mission: The mission of ACSES is to: facilitate social bonding among students in CDO, CSE and other computation-related programs, offer a platform for students to gather and discuss ongoing research and popular computational science and engineering topics, and to promote the CDO/CSE programs to more students and scholars who are interested in computational science and engineering.

name: Association of Indonesian Students at MIT
mission: The AIS-MIT shall serve as a focus at MIT for all students, as well as other members of the MIT community, interested in Indonesia culture and affairs. The AIS-MIT shall also be active in organizing activities aimed at fostering interaction among the Indonesian community and introducing Indonesia and its culture to the rest of MIT community as well as those outside MIT.

name: Association of Puerto Rican Students
mission: The purpose of this organization is to further the following objectives:- To improve the quality of life for all Puerto Rican students at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.- To promote Puerto Rican culture through social and cultural activities.- To increase the enrollment of Puerto Rican Students at MIT through active recruitments at MIT, at our homes, or whenever the opportunity arises to bring students to MIT.- To work in solidarity with other minority student groups or any other group which seeks our support.

name: Association of Taiwanese Students  MIT
mission: MIT ATS aims to bring Taiwanese food and culture to the broader MIT community.

name: Asymptones
mission: We are MIT's low-time-commitment a cappella group with a focus on fun and nerdy music. We are dedicated to being a lower-time commitment option (with three and a half hours of rehearsal a week instead of six) in order to help members balance a cappella singing with classes and other activities.

name: Australia and New Zealand Club
mission: The purpose of the Australia and New Zealand Club (ANZ) is to foster connections between Australian and New Zealand students at MIT, while hosting events for the wider MIT community interested in Australian and New Zealander culture.

name: Bahai Association  MIT
mission: Our mission is to foster a vibrant community based on the principles of the Bahá'í Faith, promoting unity, equality, and peace. We aim to provide a welcoming space for spiritual growth, learning, and the development of moral and ethical standards. Through dialogue, service, and friendship, we seek to contribute positively to our campus and the wider community, embodying the Bahá'í teachings of oneness and harmony.

name: Ballroom Dance Club
mission: MIT Ballroom Dance Club is an organization bringing together MIT community members with a passion for social ballroom dancing. Through our events, we strive to offer opportunities for our members to learn how to dance and to socialize with other attendees sharing a passion for dancing.

name: Ballroom Dance Team  MIT
mission: We are the MIT Ballroom Dance Team, an organization of MIT students and affiliates who love competitive ballroom dancing. We help our members improve their dancing technique and support their participation in ballroom dance competitions. We encourage anyone in the MIT community to join us as long as you have an interest in competitive ballroom dance, whether you have any dance experience or not.

name: Bangladeshi Students
mission: Welcome to the Bangladeshi Student Association at MIT, where we foster a vibrant community of students dedicated to celebrating and promoting Bangladeshi culture, heritage, and identity. Our mission is to provide a supportive and inclusive space for Bangladeshi students at MIT, as well as those interested in Bangladeshi culture, to come together, connect, and engage in meaningful dialogue and activities.We strive to organize events and initiatives that showcase the rich tapestry of Bangladeshi traditions, including cultural festivals, language classes, and culinary experiences. Through these activities, we aim to increase awareness and appreciation of Bangladeshi culture among the MIT community and beyond.

name: Baptist Student Fellowship
mission: The Baptist Student Fellowship is an officially recognized student group at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. BSF is an interdenominational Christian group of students started by baptists long ago. We are dedicated to providing fellowship, support, and food (physical & spiritual!) for our members to grow in knowing Jesus Christ. We are a place for undergrads, graduate students, or others studying at MIT to encounter God, discuss the Bible, grow in faith with one another and to help connect with local churches. BSF is a student run organization with support from the Baptist Chaplain and staff.

name: Battlecode
mission: The mission of Battlecode, MIT's premier programming competition, is to give students the opportunity to learn about the basics of strategy/game theory and programming, as well as good coding practices, and apply the knowledge that they have learned to competition. Competitors in Battlecode have a chance to play scrimmages and tournaments against other teams, network with sponsors, and win prizes.

name: Bhangra Club  MIT
mission: America’s oldest collegiate Bhangra team, we are a group of individuals from MIT and the Boston area who love bhangra and are dedicated to exhibiting the energy and excitement that comes with it! Since our humble beginnings in 1991, we have always stayed passionate to our mission of spreading and sharing the bhangra lifestyle.

name: Biology Undergraduate Students Association
mission: The purpose of this organization is to further the following objectives:To bring together MIT undergraduates who are interested in learning about and discussing biology.To connect MIT undergraduates interested in biology with faculty in the biology department.To conduct outreach in the community by sharing the biology knowledge of MIT undergraduates through teaching programs at local schools and other community organizations.To represent the biology department at events such as CPW, Orientation, and Activities Midway.

name: BioMakers Group
mission: The MIT BioMakers Group (BMG) was created to inspire biomaking within the MIT community by fostering interdisciplinary collaboration, hands-on research, and a strong maker culture in the biological and chemical sciences. Through our dedicated Huang-Hobbs BioMakerSpace, we provide students with the tools, space, and support to develop their own projects, gain essential lab skills, and grow within a passionate, inclusive community. By hosting workshops, speaker events, classes, and collaborative initiatives, BMG empowers students to learn, create, and contribute to a growing network of bio makerspaces across university campuses.

name: Biotechnology Group  MIT
mission: The MIT Biotechnology Group aims to provide MIT community members from all backgrounds with the knowledge and resources to become future leaders in biotech. We strive to cultivate innovation, nurture collaborative relationships with industry leaders, and increase diversity within the Boston-Cambridge life sciences ecosystem.

name: Bitcoin Club  MIT
mission: The purpose of the MIT Bitcoin Club is to provide a forum where Bitcoin-related ideas, projects, programs, events, and businesses can be studied, discussed, and developed. Through club activities, we seek to increase awareness and use of Bitcoin within and beyond the MIT community.

name: Black Graduate Student Association
mission: The purpose of the BGSA is to cultivate community and provide a safe space of Black students across MIT. Our activities fall along the lines of social events, political events, and cultural events.

name: Black Students' Union
mission: The mission of this organization is to provide support for Black students and to promote social interactions between students, faculty, staff, and alumni. The organization shall also aid in efforts to improve the welfare of the Black community at MIT.

name: Black Women's Alliance
mission: The Black Women's Alliance's Mission is as follows:To provide a forum to address the needs and concerns of black female and non-binary undergraduate students at MIT;To promote the awareness of black female-aligned issues in the MIT community through activities designed to increase the visibility of black women on campus;To encourage interaction with other campus groups;To encourage the scholarship of black women and non-binary people at MIT; andTo promote activism, unity, allyship, friendship, and community andTo promote inclusivity across all genders and sexual identities within BWA and on MIT’s campus

name: Borderline
mission: The Borderline began as a project to cover the 200 foot long wall in the tunnels under the campus of MIT. The tunnel is a commonly used route between MIT Buildings 66 and E17 during bad weather; it is a useful connection to get from point A to point B, but Borderline aimed to make it a destination through art and technology.In the spring of 2017, over 25 MIT-affiliated artists started painting murals in the tunnels. Since then, Borderline has expanded to over 65 murals in the tunnels and Banana Lounge (26-110) on campus. More murals and animations are being added every semester.Beyond the tunnels, Borderline has collaborated on projects with numerous organizations, such as the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston and Porto Seguro Cultural Center in São Paulo, Brazil. Borderline has been featured in The Boston Globe, VICE Motherboard, and other publications.The magic of Borderline comes in the form of augmented reality via the Artivive app, available for Android and iOS. Simply point your phone camera at the AR-enabled murals to unearth hidden animations!

name: BR@MIT
mission: The purpose of the BR@MIT is to disseminate Brazilian culture through the MIT community and promote events that stimulate cultural awareness. Additionally we hope to serve as a bridge between MIT and Brazilian students who would like to know more about MIT life and the application process.

name: Brain and Cognitive Sciences Society
mission: The purpose of the Brain and Cognitive Sciences Society is to serve as the official undergraduate association for MIT students majoring or minoring in Brain and Cognitive Sciences (Course 9 and 6-9). This includes providing academic information and career-related resources such as Course 9 and 6-9 classes and requirements, graduate school options, career development strategies and MIT resources as a whole; additionally, the group strives to be a source of communication between undergraduates and other members of BCS community such as M-eng students, PhDs, and faculty.

name: Brain Trust
mission: MIT BrainTrust is one of the founding chapters of Synapse, a national organization composed of student-run service organizations whose primary aim is to serve local individuals with brain injury and other brain-related conditions. To support these individuals, we organize a variety of events such as social gatherings (ex: trips to the Museum of Fine Arts, picnics at MIT) and technology help sessions. We also have a unique buddy program, where we directly pair students and individuals with brain injury in order to provide these individuals with further guidance, immediate advice, and friendship. In addition to supporting local individuals with brain injury, we also strive to educate the community about brain-related disorders through panel lectures featuring physicians, researchers, and patients; brain injury discussion panels; and brain injury awareness booths.Through these initiatives, we hope to provide real-world opportunities to students and the greater MIT community interested in topics such as cognitive science, healthcare, medicine, assistive technology, and cognitive/neurological prosthetics. BrainTrust helps our student members expand their understanding of the patient side of many neurological conditions and also learn about new technologies being developed in the healthcare field.

name: Buddhist Students Club
mission: We provide an engaging platform for students to explore Buddhist philosophy and meditation practices. Open to all levels of practice and previous engagement with religion, ethics, and spirituality.

name: Bulgarian Club at MIT
mission: The Bulgarian Club is a non-profit organization of students at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, centered around celebrating Bulgarian culture and traditions.

name: Camp Kesem MIT
mission: The mission of Camp Kesem at MIT is to support children through and beyond their parent's cancer. CK MIT counselors are dedicated to serving our 200+ campers both at camp and throughout the school year, and fostering a place where they can feel safe, loved, and respected within a community of peers facing similar challenges.

name: Campus Crusade for Cthulhu  MIT
mission: The Campus Crusade for Cthulhu serves to  informal social and literary interest group, rather than a religious group, surrounding the Cthulhu mythos and the literary works of H. P. Lovecraft,et. al.

name: Campus Hope
mission: Campus Hope seeks to connect Seventh-Day Adventist students through fellowship, worship, service, and spiritual growth during their time at university.

name: Canadians Club
mission: We bring together the Canadian community at MIT.From hosting social events, supporting Canadians, to creating professional connections -- we help Canadians in Cambridge/Boston change the world.---From our humble beginnings as a "mom and pop” type operation to hosting the largest gatherings of Canadians in Boston, the MIT Canadians Club has been in operation as early as 1991 to support fellow Canadians and Friends of Canada! Over the years we have sponsored the undefeated Canadian Hockey Teams (such as the Loonies), spreading Canadian delicacies such as Poutine, Nanaimo bars, and Timmies to all comers, meeting with 3+ generations of Consul Generals, and more in efforts to make Cambridge feel a little more like home. These days, we ambitiously strive to provide the best social events, supports, and professional connections for Canadians at MIT and other local area schools.

name: Casino Rueda
mission: To teach and share the Cuban dance style Casino Rueda

name: Caving Club
mission: The purpose of this organization is to promote exploration and generation of caves, tunnels, nooks, crannies, and other confined spaces within and without the Institute.

name: Cello World
mission: The mission of Cello World is to foster a community among cello enthusiasts at MIT by maintaining a cello ensemble that practices and performs repertoire as well as providing a space to casually play cello pieces.

name: Central American and Caribbean Friendship & Engagement
mission: The Central American and Caribbean Friendship & Engagement club acts as a way of unifying all MIT Affiliates with Central American and/or Caribbean roots. We also seek to connect any member of the MIT community to Central American and Caribbean cultures by hosting events and creating a network of alumni. Additionally, we plan on supporting the MIT application process of talented Central American and Caribbean students, and ease the transition of newly admitted students into MIT culture.

name: Central Asian Association
mission: We aim to create a welcoming community for everyone interested in Central Asian history and to foster a Central Asian community within Boston. The group will give a space for interested students to delve deep into several cultures including, Kazakh, Uzbek, Kyrgyz, Tajik, Turkmen, Uyghur and other central asian nations, while exchanging experience from several countries and regions in an inclusive way.

name: Centrifugues
mission: The purpose of The MIT Centrifugues is to perform mashups of pop, classic rock, and R&B songs, whereby the primary instrument shall be the human voice.

name: Chabad Student Group
mission: Predicated on the Mitzvah of “V’Ahavta L’Re’a’cha Kamocha – love your neighbor as yourself,” we seek to foster a sense of Jewish identity and belonging by engaging Jewish students at their own pace and comfort level in a warm and non-judgmental environment, and by offering innovative educational programs in all areas of Jewish life.Chabad seeks to be a home away from home for every Jew on campus. We offer a wealth of social, educational and spiritual programs for the entire Jewish community at MIT. At college, students are exposed to new ideas and experiences; Chabad seeks to ensure that students graduate as stronger and more empowered Jews.

name: Chemistry Graduate Student Committee
mission: The Chemistry Graduate Student Committee exists to represent, serve, support, and advocate for graduate students in Chemistry at MIT. Our goals include providing social events, career development, networking, personal and professional support, and community for graduate students of all levels across chemistry disciplines. We aim to provide these things in a welcoming and inclusive community dedicated to all students in the Chemistry department.

name: Chess Club
mission: Our mission at the MIT Chess Club is to cultivate a vibrant community where chess enthusiasts of all levels can come together to learn, practice, and compete in a friendly and supportive environment. We are dedicated to fostering an appreciation for the game of chess and promoting a deeper understanding of its strategic complexities. Through our activities and events, we aim to build a diverse and inclusive community at MIT, united by our shared passion for chess.

name: Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship
mission: MIT students passionately following Jesus Christ.Rooted in the Bible and empowered by the Holy Spirit, we gather weekly for worship, study, and fellowship. We believe in building authentic relationships where we love and support each other as we draw closer to God and live for Him at MIT. Whether through our Family Nights, Regroups, or community events, we’re here to walk this journey together.

name: China Innovation and Entrepreneurship Forum
mission: The "MIT China Innovation and Entrepreneurship Forum (MIT-CHIEF)" was established by Chinese international students at MIT and dates back to 2011, making it the longest-running Chinese innovation and entrepreneurship forum organized by college students in North America. Every year, the forum invites top scientists, entrepreneurs, and investors to discuss the challenges, trends, and outlooks faced during the processes of technological innovation and commercialization.

name: Chinese Entrepreneurs Organization
mission: MIT CEO was founded to help members to build world-class companies, to create a sustained collaboration mechanism between high-tech communities and large corporations across China and the U.S., and to help efficiently connect esteemed investors with high quality startups around the Greater Boston area.

name: Chinese Students and Scholars Association
mission: The mission of MIT CSSA is to support its members on the pursuit of academic and socialachievements at MIT and to promote the Chinese culture to the rest of the MIT community.

name: Chinese Students Club
mission: Founded in 1916, we're the oldest cultural club at MIT. Throughout the years we've continued to be a hub for people who like Chinese-American culture, good food, and good company. If you also like these, check out our many events!

name: Chorallaries of MIT
mission: Our mission is to enrich the MIT commitment through acapella, in the form of performances for official Institute events, gigs for clubs and other groups, and semesterly concerts free of charge to the MIT community.

name: Christians on Campus
mission: Christians on Campus is an ASA recognized student group of MIT. We love the Lord Jesus and endeavor to give Him the "first place in all things" (Col. 1:18). We meet together on campus, in homes, and in other settings to encourage one another, receive nourishment from the Bible and grow in Christ. We desire and seek that all our fellow students would come to know Christ as God and Savior. Christians on Campus also endeavors to help all Christians to build the Church, the Body of Christ, according to the Lord's desire as revealed in the Holy Word. We hold the faith which is common to all believers regarding our salvation. We receive all believers in Christ and encourage all others to believe into Christ.

name: Civil and Environmental Engineering Students Association
mission: The Civil and Environmental Engineering Students Association (CEESA) is the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) Student Chapter at MIT and strives to uphold the values of excellence in academic and professional environments. Through service projects, educational programs, and social functions, CEESA aims to foster a vibrant and supportive community that enables every student to reach their highest potential.

name: Climate and Energy Prize
mission: The MIT Climate & Energy Prize connects student climate entrepreneurs, MITstudents, and a network of interested community members who arepassionate about energy, climate change, and entrepreneurship. Since 2007, the Climate & Energy Prize has been MIT’s flagship climate entrepreneurship platform for student entrepreneurs to gain experience,visibility, and funding for their ventures.

name: Climbing Club
mission: The purpose of our group is to increase the accessibility of indoor rock climbing within the MIT community and form an indoor rock climbing community. We want to provide transportation to and from climbing gyms, be able to subsidize day passes/ memberships for students who would otherwise not be able to afford them and form a community.  We will focus on several types of climbing including lead, bouldering, and top rope. We want to appeal to a variety of community members- from people who have never rock climbed before to experienced climbers. We hope to provide a warm and welcoming environment for students at MIT to join and take a break from their PSETS.

name: Clubchem
mission: The purpose of the Club is to encourage interaction between faculty and students, to provide a social environment for members, and to represent a population of MIT whose interests involve chemistry.

name: Code for Good
mission: The purpose of Code for Good is to bring students together with local nonprofit organizations to make a direct, positive impact on our community using computer science skills

name: College Republicans
mission: The MIT College Republicans is a group of students united by shared conservative values which it wishes to promote within MIT and the surrounding community. The group shall seek to inform its members about the philosophy of the Republican Party; provide logistical support and assistance to local, state, and national campaigns; raise awareness about issues pertinent to the Republican Party; and develop the civic engagement, political skills, and leadership abilities of its members to prepare them for future service their community.

name: Colombian Association of MIT
mission: The Colombian Student Association of MIT is a student-led organization recognized by MIT's Association of Student Activities (ASA). Our purpose is to share the Colombian culture at MIT and the Greater Boston Area, to bring together the Colombian MIT community, to organize academic and non-academic events with other student associations, to strengthen relationships between academia and policymakers in Colombia interested in the fields of study promoted by MIT, and to foster the connection between MIT and Colombia.

name: Concert Band
mission: The MIT Concert Band is a group of amateur musicians.Participation in the group should provide a sense of enjoyment and enthusiasm in thecreation of music. The group should be open to persons of all musical backgrounds andskills, and it should provide a vehicle for developing musical talents in a large ensemblesetting. Student members should feel a sense of ownership in the group.

name: Concert Choir Students
mission: The purpose of this organization shall be to externally support, rep- resent, and serve the students of the MIT Concert Choir (21M.401); to promote the Choir’s concerts, auditions, and activities; and to serve as a general advocate for choral music at MIT.

name: Consulting Club at MIT
mission: The Consulting Club at MIT (CCM) aims to facilitate a seamless transition from graduate school to a successful career in management consulting through awareness, skill building, and networking.

name: Consulting Group
mission: The purpose of the Consulting Group is to educate and develop members professionally through industry and recruiting events, mentorship, community bonding events, and case studies with companies.

name: Council for Math Majors
mission: The Council for Math Majors (CoMM) is a student-run advocacy group in Course 18 committed to amplifying undergraduate voices and opinions within the math department. CoMM gathers input from students to understand what parts of the undergraduate experience could benefit from revision, from best advising practices to resources available on the math department website. Then, CoMM collaborates with faculty and staff to suggest improvements and work towards department-wide solutions.

name: Cross Products
mission: The MIT Cross Products are a Christian a cappella group that communicates the good news of Jesus Christ through music, skits, and the spoken word. We exist to glorify God through music and our lives, and to tell others of the ways He has changed us.

name: Cru
mission: To be a movement led and empowered by the Holy Spirit to help every student on campus hear and experience the Gospel of Jesus Christ, build students to be devoted followers of Jesus, and to send out equipped laborers to the campus and to the world to make an impact for Christ for a lifetime.

name: DanceTroupe
mission: Our student organization meets on an as-needed basis. Please email us at [include your group's officer mailing list here] for information about the date, time, and location of our next meeting.

name: Debate Team
mission: The purpose of the MIT Debate Team is to compete on the American Parliamentary DebateAssociation collegiate debate circuit, educate members about the fundamentals ofparliamentary debate, and offer opportunities to practice and write cases with a group of otherdebaters.

name: Design Build Fly
mission: To Design, Build, and Fly Airplanes

name: Design for America
mission: At MIT's Design for America, we are committed to creating social impact through engineering and design. As a group, we build, develop, and create solutions to real world problems in the local community, working with community partners in the area. In addition, we run skill-building sessions to help students gain the skills they need to make a difference and support each other in the DFA community to make the world a better place.

name: Digital Art and Animation at MIT
mission: To provide an environment where MIT community members can express their creativity through an art form of their choice and collaborate with other artists who specialize in different art forms.

name: Disability Justice Collective
mission: The MIT Disability Justice Collective explores the topics and intersection of disability, justice and liberation at MIT. We advocate for the rights, interests, and dignity of disabled persons globally, from within MIT.

name: Disabled@MIT
mission: The mission of Disabled@MIT is to build community among disabled students at MIT.

name: Doctors Without Gravity
mission: Doctors Without Gravity is the Harvard/MIT student chapter of the the Aerospace Medical Association (AsMA) with the Aerospace Medical Student and Resident Organization (AMSRO). We are a joint chapter between Harvard and MIT, the first of its kind!Our goal: To foster educational awareness and create opportunities in aerospace medicine, spaceflight biology, and human space exploration broadly. We hope to create a diverse collaborative community inclusive of everybody--from undergraduate and graduate students, to medical students, to faculty, and to all levels of training in between.

name: dynaMIT
mission: The mission of dynaMIT is to provide Boston/Cambridge area middle school students from underserved families an opportunity to learn and experience science and engineering through hands-on science experiments and challenges. This is accomplished through two free, week-long summer science programs: one week is for sixth and seventh graders, while the second week is for eighth and ninth graders. MIT undergraduates serve as mentors and role models who teach students about science and how it relates to their daily lives. The mentors give them a fun and safe environment to explore their interests, and encourage them to consider potential careers in science and technology.

name: E33 Productions
mission: E33 does lights.

name: EAPS Student Advisory Committee
mission: E-SAC is a student-run group that organizes social events and support programs aimed atbringing the EAPS graduate student community closer together. E-SAC also serves as a forumfor student concerns and represents those concerns to the administration and faculty.

name: Educational Studies Program
mission: Spreading the joy of teaching and learning.

name: Educational Technologies Group
mission: The purpose of ACME is to establish a place where all minority graduate students are encouraged to share goals and expectations, express ideas, concepts, and frustrations without rebuke, while fostering an atmosphere of accountability.

name: Egyptian Association
mission: The Egyptian Association is a student body whose members are united by their common interest in Egyptian culture. The club aims to raise awareness of the multifaceted cultural identity by hosting events which feature prominent speakers, and through the lens of media and arts exposure. Events will also introduce Egyptian and middle eastern cuisine to the community while celebrating the diverse observances.

name: Electrochemical Society
mission: The purpose of the ECS MIT Student Chapter is to create an institute-wide community of students interested in electrochemistry and to promote this area at MIT and beyond.

name: Electronic Research Society
mission: To encourage and assist student projects for electronic and mechanical construction.

name: EMS MIT
mission: To support the health of the MIT campus and greater Cambridge and Boston communities.

name: Engineers Without Borders
mission: MIT Engineers Without Borders is a chapter of EWB-USA, a non-profit organization that partners with communities in developing countries in order to implement community-driven projects that will be both beneficial and sustainable.

name: Entrepong
mission: Our mission is to connect undergraduate and graduate students interested in entrepreneurship with each other and with entrepreneurs who have experience in the field all over a game of ping pong.

name: Eta Kappa Nu
mission: Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) is a national honors society for electrical engineering and computer science. Our chapter of HKN — Beta Theta — is MIT’s distinguished community of exceptional computer scientists who leverage their intellect and expertise to solve the most pressing problems at MIT and beyond. At HKN, we offer exclusive career opportunities to members and connect them with HKN alumni in elite graduate programs, companies, non-profit organizations, and government agencies. We are the backbone of top-of-the-line student academic support in Course 6. We are also the foundation of many digital services used widely by the community, including the Underground Guide.

name: Ethiopian Eritrean Students Association
mission: The purpose of MIT EESA is to bring about awareness and understanding of Ethiopian/Eritrean culture to the MIT community, as well as to residents of the Cambridge and Boston area. In addition, the group will strive to create a venue where Ethiopian/Eritrean students and those interested in Ethiopian/Eritrean culture can interact and learn from one another's experiences.

name: European Club
mission: The MIT European Club organizes social and cultural events that promote the interaction between MIT students and affiliates with other greater‐Boston‐area students and scholars, whether they are from Europe, or just have an interest in Europe. The MIT European Club organizes an annual career fair to allow the hiring of interested candidates by companies or institutions that are European or that have European subsidiaries.

name: Filipino Students Association
mission: The MIT Filipino Students Association (FSA) is a community of people who appreciate Filipino culture. The group seeks to:• provide a community for Filipino or Filipino-identifying students;• strengthen members’ connections with their culture and heritage; and• promote awareness of Filipino culture within the greater MIT community.

name: Fixation
mission: MIT Fixation was originally founded in Spring of 2010 by a group of dedicated dancers who are committed to improving on the contemporary dance styles, including lyrical, contemp, jazz, etc. MIT Fixation wants to showcase these styles at MIT and at other schools in the Greater Boston area. Past performances have included guest performances at World of Dance, Ring the Alarm, Footwork, Breaking Bounds, and guest performances for various MIT clubs and dance groups. In 2022, we started the tradition of choreographing and hosting our very own annual team showcase in the spring as a way to share the diverse forms of dance that our team is capable of with MIT and beyond. Most importantly, we want to have fun dancing!

name: Flying Club
mission: To enhance access to aviation for students and members in the greater Boston area.

name: French Association
mission: This organization aims at bringing together French community at MIT including:French students and staff and their spouses and partners.Québec (Canada) students and staff and their partners.French speaking community at MIT.French culture enthusiasts.The organization’s actions include:Organize events that foster and share French culture in MIT campus.Gather French speaking community in MIT campus.Enabling connections between MIT and other French associations in Boston area, in the United States and/or France.The organization aims to be welcoming, inclusive and open to anyone who wants to belong to this community.

name: Fuyun Chinese Comedy Club
mission: The mission of our group is to create a community for the Chinese Traditional Crosstalk (Xiangsheng) comedians to improve their performing skills by sharing learning experiences among ourselves and to organize regular comedy show events to serve the public, who are interested in this unique Chinese culture.

name: G@MIT
mission: G@MIT is a student organization with a mission to provide community, support, and advocacy for undergraduate LBGTQ+ students.

name: Game Developers Guild
mission: The purpose of the Game Developers Guild is to foster community among students interested in game design and development, including but not limited to game designers and developers, artists, music composers, and animators.

name: Generational African American Student Association
mission: The purpose of the Generational African American Student Association  is to support the welfare of Generational African American students on campus, to increase understanding and awareness of the specific struggles of those descending from the system of slavery in the United States, and to combat those struggles inside of and outside of the MIT community.

name: GFLI@MIT
mission: MIT's community of First Generation/Low Income students across all Graduate Programs. This group aims to provide a sense of community for graduate students from first generation/low income (GFLI) backgrounds, as well as providing them with the skills and connections to help them thrive at MIT graduate programs and beyond.

name: Global Startup Workshop
mission: The MIT Global Startup Workshop Group, or GSW, aims to support the development of healthy entrepreneurial ecosystems globally.

name: Go Club
mission: The purpose of The MIT Go Club, hereafter referred to as the Club, is to promote the game ofGo within MIT. To accomplish this goal, the Club strives to provide facilities where all membersof the community can meet to enjoy the game of Go. It may also sponsor events that promoteawareness and enjoyment of the game

name: Graduate Association of Aeronautics and Astronautics
mission: For AeroAstro Graduate Students, promote student well-being, establish a formal student-department relationship, foster a sense of professional and personal community within the department, increase department presence and student involvement throughout MIT.

name: Graduate Association of Mechanical Engineers
mission: The purpose of the Graduate Association of Mechanical Engineers (GAME) is to represent current graduate students within the Mechanical Engineering department at MIT. Our goal is to organize social and professional activities which strengthen and enrich the community within the department, and to help publicize various research activities within the department. We organize social hours, host talks by guest speakers and students, and help communicate with the department and the Graduate Student Council We encourage all current Mechanical Engineering graduate students to come forward and participate in the group. Members along with the GAME officers play important roles in spearheading many of GAME's initiatives, activities, and student advocacy issues.

name: Graduate Christian Fellowship
mission: Graduate Christian Fellowship is a faith community of Christians in the MIT community, primarily graduate students, who desire to know, love and obey God better and to reflect the love and presence of Jesus Christ. We strive to accomplish this in the following ways:1) Encourage one another to deepen our individual relationships with Jesus Christ by emphasizing a foundation of prayer, study of the Bible, worship, obedience to God and involvement with local churches.2) Be a community that addresses the unique needs of Christian graduate students and that cares for one another as part of God’s larger family.3) Think critically about the implications of the Christian faith on our academic disciplines. Bring our pursuits, careers, and all our work under the lordship of Christ.4) Corporately and individually proclaim Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior to the MIT community.5) Help meet the physical and personal needs of our neighbors at MIT and in the Boston area.

name: Graduate Economics Association
mission: The GEA organizes social events and acts as a liaison between students and faculty.

name: Graduate Hillel
mission: As the center for Jewish life at MIT, MIT Hillel is a welcoming, pluralistic environment for all Jewish students, as well as for Jewish MIT alumni, faculty, and staff. Hillel celebrates and supports the development of individual Jewish identities on the MIT campus and within the greater Jewish community.https://hillel.mit.edu/content/our-mission

name: Graduate Materials Council
mission: The Graduate Materials Council acts as advocates for DMSE graduate students. Members of the GMC serve on the Graduate Student Council, the institute-wide graduate committee and three student representatives serve on the Departmental Committee on Graduate Studies, the group responsible for decisions regarding the curriculum and qualifying procedures. The group also plans many social activities for the students in the department, as well as field teams for intramural sports.

name: Graduate Muslim Students Association
mission: The mission of the Graduate Muslim Student Association (GMSA) is to provide a dedicated community space that specifically addresses the spiritual, social, and professional needs of Muslim graduate students. Unlike the already existing Muslim Student Association (MSA), the GMSA uniquely focuses on graduate students’ experiences and responsibilities, which differ significantly from those of undergraduates—the primary target audience of the MSA. The community space aims to facilitate deeper connections among graduate peers, provide tailored spiritual guidance, offer networking and professional development opportunities specifically relevant to graduate students, and support members navigating challenges unique to graduate life, including balancing intensive academic research, career preparation, and family responsibilities.The raison d’être of the GMSA arose naturally from the consistently low turnout of graduate students at MSA events and from the expressed enthusiasm within the graduate community for establishing a dedicated association that actively responds to their specific circumstances and needs. Through this distinct focus, the GMSA seeks not only to strengthen the engagement of Muslim graduate students within the MIT community but also to enhance collaboration with other graduate-focused organizations, enriching the broader campus experience.

name: Graduate Women in Aerospace Engineering
mission: The purpose of Graduate Women in Aerospace Engineering (GWAE), is to representand support the women and gender minorities in the MIT Department of Aeronauticsand Astronautics. The organization will:1. Foster a strong community among AeroAstro graduate women and genderminorities2. Recruit women and underrepresented minorities and advocate for diversity incollaboration with the MIT AeroAstro Diversity, Inclusion, and Innovation.Committee3. Support the personal, academic, and professional development of AeroAstrograduate women and gender minority students4. Enhance ties with AeroAstro undergraduate women and gender minoritiesthrough sponsorship of a graduate-undergraduate mentor program5. Participate in STEM outreach events6. Maintain a relationship between AeroAstro women faculty and graduate women7. Serve as a liaison for communication between the AeroAstro department and thegraduate women body

name: Graduate Women of Course 6
mission: The purpose of the Graduate Women’s Group of Course 6 is to enhance the experience of women in EECS.  The group will provide graduate women in EECS an opportunity to network with other women in the department, develop mentorships and friendships, and gain support in completing their degree.  We are also interested in providing mentorship to undergraduate women in EECS.A further goal of the Graduate Women's Group of Course 6 is to support and initiate outreach programs in order to encourage younger women to explore engineering. In addition, we aim to enrich the professional development of graduate women in EECS and broaden their perspective of future career paths.

name: Greater China Student Network
mission: The purpose of the Greater China Student Network (GCSN) is to provide a comfortable space for Chinese students and the Mandarin-speaking community. We provide support to each other, celebrate holidays, and promote Chinese culture together.

name: Hacking Medicine
mission: The purpose of the MIT Hacking Medicine is to infect, energize, and empower a diverse, global community in healthcare entrepreneurship and innovation to scale medicine to attack and solve healthcare problems.

name: Harvard MIT Mathematics Tournament
mission: Our mission is to encourage interest in math, to engage a diverse community of students and support them in reaching beyond traditional math curriculums, and to provide insight into what a future in math may look like.

name: Hawaii Club
mission: Hawaiʻi Club seeks to provide support for MIT students from Hawaiʻi and connect them with each other. Hawaiʻi Club also seeks to share Hawaiian culture and modern Hawaiʻi culture to the MIT community.

name: Hellenic Students Association
mission: The mission of the Hellenic Students' Association (HSA) at MIT is to build a cohesive and supportive community for MIT students of Greek and Cypriot origin. The association aims to achieve this by organizing a wide array of activities encompassing cultural, social, athletic, artistic, and educational domains. In addition, the HSA serves to welcome and guide newly admitted Hellenic students and acts as a liaison between the Hellenic student body, MIT officials, other student organizations, and Hellenic communities globally. The association operates in adherence with MIT's regulations, notably refraining from engaging in political activities as defined by the Institute.

name: Hillel MIT
mission: As the center for Jewish life at MIT, MIT Hillel is a welcoming, pluralistic environment for all Jewish students, as well as for Jewish MIT alumni, faculty, and staff. Hillel celebrates and supports the development of individual Jewish identities on the MIT campus and within the greater Jewish community.MIT Hillel offers a vibrant program of religious, educational, social, and Israel activities that enable the exploration of Jewish culture, tradition, and scholarship. Hillel strives to satisfy the spiritual, intellectual, and personal needs of all Jewish students.Hillel enriches the lives of Jewish students so that they may enrich the Jewish people and the world.

name: Hindu Students Council
mission: MIT Hindu Student Council brings together all those who are inspired by the unbroken lineage of spiritual and philosophical thinkers, Rishis and Rishikas, who have sought answers for eternal truths.We are the followers of Sanatan Dharma, practitioners of 5000 years of unbroken principle that tells us that “ekam sat vipra bahudha vadanti: That which exists is One; the sages call it by various names. We are a community that fosters the Sanatan Hindu philosophy, culture and religion within the MIT and adjoining community.We celebrate Pujas and Festivals and seek to spread the joy of knowledge. We are here for each other, our goal is to help each of us discover the divine within and realize “thou art that” tat tvam asi.The mission of MIT HSC is to promote understanding of Hindu culture and heritage, foster awareness of issues affecting Hinduism, and provide service to the community. We do this by helping students experience Hinduism through celebrations of Hindu festivals, regular discussions, satsanga sessions, classes and symposia and guest lectures. We are open to people and ideas of all faiths and backgrounds.Whether you identify as a Hindu or are curious about the religion, we welcome you to join us!

name: HongKong@MIT
mission: The organization undertakes to provide guidance and support to newly matriculated students, to promote the exchange of cultural values between members of the MIT community and those of Hong Kong, and to orchestrate and administer events of a social, academic, and professional nature that concern Hong Kong, its culture, and its peoples.

name: Horology Club
mission: The purpose of the Horology Club is to introduce MIT students to the basic principles of mechanical watch making and repair.

name: HST Student Community
mission: The graduate students and medical students in HST shall be known collectively as the HST student community. Their official representative body shall be known as the HST Joint Council.The purposes of the HST Joint Council are:1. To encourage a sense of community within HST2. To provide a formal means of communication among graduate students, medical students and the HST Administration3. To ensure student representation within the HST, Harvard, and MIT communities4. Advocate for HST students as necessary with HST, MIT, and Harvard administration5. To manage funds allocated by the HST administration for student use6. To build a social community of medical engineers and medical scientists within MIT and Harvard

name: IAP Web Programming Competition
mission: Students form teams of 1-3 people and learn how to build a functional and user-friendly website. Lectures and workshops teach everything you need to make a complete web application. Topics include version control, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ReactJS, and nodejs. All teams are eligible to enter a competition where sites will be judged by industry experts. Beginners and experienced web programmers welcome, but some previous programming experience is recommended.  Students must register at https://portal.weblab.is. Registering via WebSIS does NOT automatically put you on the official class mailing list.

name: IDSS Student Council
mission: The purpose of the IDSS Student Council is to promote community within the diverse programs, labs, and student groups associated with our academic unit, IDSS. We also provide a channel to connect IDSS students with IDSS leadership.

name: Imobilare
mission: We are MIT’s premiere breakdancing/freestyling crew, founded in 1991. We help to keep breakdancing culture alive on campus and in Cambridge/Boston communities. We actively participate in Boston’s hip-hop scene and work with breakdancing crews and non-profits alike to bring freestyling to as many people as possible. We offer classes on campus, participate in events, and hold public practice sessions and small cyphers for all MIT students and the general public to join.

name: Impact@MIT
mission: The purpose of Impact@MIT is to support the efforts of members of the MIT community interested in having a positive impact in the world.

name: Individualized Tutoring for English and Citizenship
mission: ITEC (Individualized Tutoring for English and Citizenship) empowers immigrants in Massachusetts by providing free, one-on-one virtual tutoring in conversational English and citizenship exam preparation. By pairing them with MIT students who have a passion for service, ITEC fosters cross-cultural exchange, promotes community service, and equips students with a deeper understanding of the immigration and naturalization process.

name: Infinite Magazine
mission: Infinite Magazine's purpose is to foster a collaborative creative community and enable members to be able to learn and exercise skills pertaining to fashion design, fabrication, photography, visual and graphic design, writing, etc. To showcase each year's worth of effort, the club produces a tangible culmination of member work in the form of a magazine.

name: Informs MIT
mission: We are the student chapter of the Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences (INFORMS) professional organization. We organize department events for students (and occasionally faculty and alumni) of MIT's Operations Research Center.

name: Institute of Electrical & Electronics Engineers
mission: The MIT IEEE/ACM Club represents the student branch for two professional international organizations, the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) and the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM).Our mission is to create and support a tight-knit community among the students and faculty in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) at MIT.Get involved with all things course 6 and beyond by coming to our events! You'll meet students who are just as passionate as you are in the diverse color spectrum that is course 6 as well as professors and leaders in the field.

name: International Students Association
mission: The purpose of this organization is to further the following objectives:(a) To bring together the diverse community of undergraduate and graduate internationalstudents at MIT(b) To improve the well-being and MIT experience of international students, supporting themthroughout their education at MIT as well as in their future endeavors.(c) To create a network of current, admitted, and former international students to provideguidance, facilitate transition, and increase enrollment.(d) To facilitate the sharing of cultural, academic, and social elements from the diverse backgroundsof international students with each other and the broader MIT community.(e) To serve as a vessel for international students to access resources and opportunities at MITand the broader MIT community.(f ) To foster unique collaborative events between international and cultural clubs at MIT.

name: Intervarsity
mission: The purpose of MIT InterVarsity (MIT-IV) is to be a diverse witnessing community seeking to see lives transformed through engaging with the Person of Jesus by growing in love for God, God’s Word, people of every ethnicity & culture, and God’s purposes in the world. We seek to develop as followers of Jesus Christ as Lord and Savior in response to God’s love, grace and truth. We aim to actively engage with campus as participants of the larger MIT community.

name: iQuHACK
mission: Our purpose is to provide educational experiences for students and enthusiasts interested in quantum information science and quantum technology, and seek to connect students with leading quantum technology experts in academia and in industry.

name: Irish Dance Club
mission: The mission of the MIT Irish Dance Club is to foster a vibrant community where students can actively participate in the art of Irish Step Dancing. Our purpose is to cultivate opportunities for learning, choreography, and performance, ensuring that individuals of all experience levels are welcomed and encouraged. Through regular classes and workshops open to both members and the broader MIT community, we aim to create an inclusive space for the exploration and practice of Irish dance. Committed to promoting teamwork, respect, and inclusivity, our club seeks to organize captivating performances both on campus and in the greater Boston-Cambridge area, providing a secure and supportive environment for all members to thrive.

name: Japanese Association
mission: The Japanese Association aim to bring cultural experiences to the MIT community by organizing events that introduces the essence of Japanese culture to students, faculty, and families. By providing a vibrant and immersive cultural experience for people of all ages and backgrounds, we hope to foster cultural exchange, build community connections, and showcase the unique Japanese traditions in a meaningful and engaging way.

name: Japanese Society of Undergraduates
mission: To promote Japanese culture within MIT.

name: Jews for Collective Liberation
mission: MIT Jews for Collective Liberation is a student group focused on providing a progressive space for Jewish students in the MIT community. We aim to create a network of Jewish students for the purpose of hosting cultural, religious, and political events aligned with the principles we work by: love, equity, and justice.

name: Kehillah
mission: MIT Kehillah is a student group focused on creating a religious space for progressive Jewish students in the MIT community. We aim to build out space for Jewish students, who currently do not feel comfortable or welcome in the MIT Jewish community, to participate in their religious and cultural practices.MIT Kehillah seeks to create Jewish space on campus that uniquely grounds spiritual and religious practices in inclusivity and progressive ideals. Our focus allows students to explore the intersectionality of their identities, demonstrating that Judaism is not monolithic but can be dynamically woven into the fabric of broader social and political conversations.Kehillah is independently run by MIT students, staff, and faculty, without influence or oversight from outside organizations. We provide a home for Jewish students who wish to engage with Jewish culture, religion, and identity in a way that is empowering, emphasizes intersectionality and diversity, and is Diaspora-centric.

name: Kenyan Students’ Club
mission: Our mission is to celebrate and promote Kenyan culture, heritage, and values while providing support for academic, professional, and personal development for our members. We strive to build meaningful connections and enhance the broader MIT community through our shared experiences and initiatives.

name: Kidney Disease Screening and Awareness Program at MIT
mission: The Kidney Disease Screening and Awareness Program raises chronic kidney disease (CKD) awareness and prevention by providing free health screenings and education for early detection of risk factors of CKD to underserved populations.

name: Knitting and Crochet Club
mission: The mission of the Knitting and Crochet Club is to provide a space for artists who like to knit, crochet, embroider, needle felt, etc., to get together for socials to 1) work on their individual projects and 2) learn new crafts as beginners.

name: Korean Cultural Association
mission: The MIT Korean Cultural Association is a cultural club dedicated to creating a community of people who are interested in Korean culture and the Korean language. We mainly organize community events that are intended to bring together these people with mutual interest or curiosity in Korean culture. Some examples of previous events with very large turnout are our Chuseok holiday celebration and Korean Street Food Festival. Both events attracted over 100 people, and our club was able to organize an event where people could come, meet people, and bond over the entertainment and food that was offered at these events. This group is an important part of campus for Korean-American students who want to connect more with their Korean background. This does NOT mean that we are just for Korean people. Anyone is welcome at any of our events, and we welcome anyone who is respectful of Korean culture.

name: Korean Graduate Students Association
mission: Contribute to MIT community and broader society from Korea-based knowledge and culture.

name: Laboratory for Chocolate Science
mission: Founded in 2003, the Laboratory for Chocolate Science (LCS) is dedicated to spreading the appreciation of chocolate on campus, and to bringing opportunities for learning about, appreciation of, and indulgence in our favorite substance to the community.

name: Latin Music Society
mission: The Latin Music Society (LMS) strives to create a space for MIT affiliates from all walks of life to rehearse, perform, and learn the cultural significance of Latin music through collaboration with their peers and professional musicians. LMS will have subgroups consisting of various genres such as mariachi, salsa/son, latin jazz, etc. and members may start groups to make music within a Latin genre of their choice.

name: Latino Cultural Center
mission: The Latino Cultural Center (LCC) functions as the hub for Latino students and student organizations, as well as individual community members interested in learning more about Latino culture. The LCC is composed of two main parts, the business offices of the student organizations, and the lounge for academic and social activities. The purpose of the LCC is to provide a space for students to meet with study groups or to study individually, to socialize, and to hold cultural and social events hosted by the six member organizations and the LCC exec team.

name: LatinX Graduate Student Association
mission: The purpose of the LGSA is to organize and maintain a thriving community that will support MIT Latinx graduate students in their personal, academic, and professional endeavors and well-being.The LGSA seeks to empower its members through the creation of a strong network within the MIT community, structured primarily through ongoing cultural and social events.Where appropriate, the LGSA will serve as a channel to represent and communicate the needs of its members to other stakeholders, including MIT’s institutional leadership.

name: Latte Lab
mission: The mission of Latte Lab is to foster a vibrant community at MIT centered around the science, craft, and culture of coffee.

name: Latter day Saint Student Association
mission: The MIT LDSSA serves as a community to help people connect through faith in Jesus Christ.

name: Leadership Training Institute
mission: The Leadership Training Institute (LTI) is a 10-week program in which MIT undergraduates mentor Boston-area high school students, helping them gain leadership skills while implementing original community service projects. Many high school students are passionate about solving community problems; however, they often lack the experience and mentorship to effectively pursue their ideas. At LTI, we offer such motivated students the skills, guidance, and individualized support to translate their ideas into real impact. By pairing local high school students from underprivileged backgrounds with MIT undergraduates who have previously implemented successful community service projects, LTI helps high school students and MIT undergraduates alike develop their untapped leadership and service potential. In this way, LTI catalyzes branching social change by cultivating innovative ideas. As a student-run organization that hosts ~60 high school students yearly at no cost to them, we depend on grants to carry out our mission.

name: Lebanese Club at MIT
mission: The LCM shall be a nonprofit, nonpartisan MIT-based organization established in 1970 to foster a sense of community among the Lebanese students at MIT and to promote Lebanese culture and concerns in the Institute and the Boston area at large.

name: Lecture Series Committee
mission: The MIT Lecture Series Committee has been bringing quality entertainment to the MIT campus since 1944. In 1950 our popular film program began. Over the years, we have kept at the forefront of cinema technology, featuring four-track magnetic surround sound when monaural sound was the norm. Thus was born the phrase "IN STEREO!" -- an in-joke in the MIT community (come to an LSC movie and find out why).Today, LSC features state-of-the-art digital motion picture projection on a 26'x13' screen and 5.1 Dolby Digital surround sound, with over 9000 watts of amplification in addition to a newly revived 35 mm projection series with a two-projector changeover system. Our weekly films showcase a diverse selection of Hollywood blockbusters, foreign and independent film, and the best of classic cinema.From time to time, LSC also features special events such as the Science Fiction Marathon, advance screenings of films not yet released to theaters, lectures by famous personalities, concerts, and more.

name: LGBT Grad
mission: We serve to support LGBTQ+ graduate students and allies at MIT. While our main focus is on the graduate community at MIT, our events and opportunities are often open to the broader queer community at MIT and beyond.

name: Life on Stage Theatre
mission: Life on Stage Theatre (LOST) is a performance group that produces plays each semester that investigate the human condition.

name: Lindy Hop Society
mission: The MIT Lindy Hop Society is a student group at MIT where folks that love to swing (dance) come together! You’ll find Lindy, Charleston, and East Coast styles on our dance floor, along with the occasional dabble in West Coast and others.We have a thriving community of student dancers, and we place strong emphasis on having a safe atmosphere where everyone can have fun and learn to dance together.

name: Lion Dance Group
mission: The purpose of this organization shall be to promote the art of Chinese liondancing on the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) campus and othercollege campuses across the East coast.

name: Live Action Mafia
mission: We play Live-Action Mafia, the real-time, real-life version of the party game Mafia.

name: Live Music Connection
mission: We strive to promote musicianship on campus and to provide an opportunity for student musicians to develop their performance skills.

name: Locksport
mission: To teach and practice responsible locksport

name: Logarhythms
mission: The mission of the MIT Logarhythms is to bring together members of the MIT community who are passionate about a cappella through rehearsal and performance and to spread music in our community and beyond.

name: LUCHA
mission: LUCHA, formerly La Union Chicana por Aztlán, is dedicated to providingboth cultural and academic support to students who identify in any way withthe Latino culture. We are a familia dedicated to supporting each otherand creating bonds that last throughout student's 4 years here at MIT.

name: Lutheran Episcopal Ministry
mission: The Lutheran Episcopal Ministry (LEM) is a Christian fellowship that welcomes all folks: undergrad, grad, or post-doc; sure of your faith or wondering what it is all about; gay, straight, bi, trans*, questioning. This is a space in which hard questions are welcome, and burdens may be shared or left at the door.

name: MAES Latinos in Science & Engineering
mission: MAES Latinos in Science and Engineering is a social and professional development club for all Latino/a/x identifying students at MIT. We strive to encourage community-building through social and cultural events, as well as professional development through events with industry partners.

name: Maghreb Students Association
mission: The MIT Maghreb Students Association (MagMIT) is a student group focused on promoting Maghrebein culture and supporting Maghrebein students at MIT. We organize social and cultural events throughout the year, both individually and in collaboration with other clubs. MagMIT aims to create an atmosphere that allows people to enjoy and explore the beautiful culture of the Maghreb region in North Africa.

name: Mahjong Club
mission: The purpose of the Mahjong club is to provide an environment that fosters a community of students who enjoy playing mahjong

name: Marching Band
mission: The One and Only MIT Marching Band

name: Medlinks
mission: The MedLinks program works to support MIT students in connecting to campus support resources, the policies and services of MIT Medical, and determining when and how to seek medical attention. MedLinks is a residentially-based peer health advocacy program that supports the health of students in their residences along with the wider MIT community through one-on-one interactions and via health promotion events. In addition, MedLinks can make available single doses of common over-the-counter medications, first aid supplies, and safer sex supplies.

name: MentorConnection
mission: The mission of MentorConnection is to facilitate conversations across all corners of the MIT campus, and between members of campus and MIT alumni.

name: Microbiome Club
mission: The purpose of the MIT Microbiome Club is to bring together inquisitive members of the Boston community, with a focus on undergraduates, graduate students, postdocs, research staff, faculty, and clinicians, in the emerging field of microbiome studies and microbiome-based medicine.

name: Middle East Entrepreneurs of Tomorrow
mission: MEET's mission is to provide young promising leaders in the Middle East with tools to challenge the status quo through innovation. Our mission as a group is to oversee MEET's operation on campus and on the MISTI side of the program.

name: MINCE
mission: We believe that food is a form of connection, significant to preserving culture, an incredibly educational journey, and also one of the most important ways to maintain your health in the firehose that is MIT. Having listened to far too many of our peers complain about the poor quality of the dining halls, the lack of variety of food choices in our area, or simply being too busy to enjoy a proper meal, we realized that culturally diverse, nourishing, and delicious meals are always in high demand. There are many of us who crave the warm comfort and nourishment of a meal, and MINCE hopes to unify students by indulging this shared desire.

name: Mirchi
mission: MIT Mirchi is MIT’s premier, competitive Bollywood-fusion dance team! Our performances incorporate both South Asian and Western styles, including Bollywood, Hip-hop, Kuthu, Contemporary, Bhangra, and Indian classical.
