Over the past 12 years, we’ve had the honor of representing MIT and greater Boston at competitions and showcases across the country, sharing our passion for dance and our love for our culture.Every year, we put together an 10 minute set, including backdrops, costumes, and other props. Our themes over the past couple years include: IT, The Wizard of Oz, Phineas and Ferb, The Parent Trap, etc. Stay tuned for our upcoming performances!

name: MissBehavior
mission: MissBehavior is MIT's first dance team representing marginalized genders, established in Spring 2019. Our team creates a safe and enjoyable space for empowerment through dance. We celebrate commercial styles and encourage exploration beyond our comfort zones. MissBehavior is a unique community for both intermediate and advanced dancers to be challenged and supported, all while having a good time.

name: MIT African Graduate Association
mission: The MIT African Graduate Association (AGA) exists to foster a strong,supportive community for MIT African graduate students, scholars, andpostdocs by catering to their unique needs and enhancing their overallwelfare. We aim to provide academic, professional, and cultural enrichmentwhile amplifying the voices and contributions of African researchers oncampus and beyond. In addition, we strive to leverage the research expertiseof MIT African graduate and post-graduate researchers while connectingthem with innovative initiatives in order to be at the forefront of African development.

name: MIT AI Alignment
mission: The mission of MIT AI Alignment (MAIA) is to raise awareness of the potentially-existential risks posed by advanced AI systems and to assist members of the MIT community in addressing these risks by means including, but not limited to, (i) providing opportunities for members of the MIT community to learn more about these issues, both from a technical and from a governance perspective, (ii) creating an environment for research and debate among members of the MIT community; and (iii) fostering a community of people who share the same concerns about the aforementioned risks.

name: MIT Albanian Students Association
mission: The purpose of the MIT Albanian Students Association is to further the following objectives:1.	To bring together the considerable community of undergraduate and graduate Albanian students and American students of Albanian descent at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, as well as anyone interested in learning more about Albanian culture and Albanians around the world.2.	To improve the well-being and MIT experience of Albanian and Albanian-American students at the Institute.3.	To provide a guidance network of current students and admitted Albanian students to facilitate the transition and increase the enrollment.

name: MIT Asian American Initiative
mission: The Asian American Initiative strives, through action and education, to promote Asian American advocacy on the MIT campus and beyond. Our club aims to provide a safe space to discuss the building blocks and facets of Asian American identity, create a platform to bring light to issues affecting the Asian American community, and improve the Asian American experience on and off campus, while supporting other marginalized groups. Our club stands in solidarity and allyship with other marginalized groups, with founding beliefs against oppressive systems such as racism, homophobia, xenophobia, classism, ableism, and sexism.

name: MIT Bridge Club
mission: To provide a platform for bridge lovers to play bridge weekly. To teach bridge to those who are interested.

name: MIT Capital Partners
mission: MIT Capital Partners provides students with exposure to and preparation for careers in startups and venture capital, while fostering a diverse, supportive community. Through educational programming, mentorship, and real-world experiences, members gain a deeper understanding of how startups grow and how investors make decisions.

name: MIT Climbing Team
mission: The purpose of the MIT Climbing Club is to develop a community of undergraduate and graduatestudents who want to reach an advanced level of rock climbing. We support students by providingstructured practices and goal-oriented training programs. Our goals are to give this communityaccess to formal training, affordable climbing facilities, and opportunities to participate in formalcompetitions and fun outdoor activities.

name: MIT Democrats
mission: MIT Democrats represents politically engaged members of the MIT community, including students, staff, faculty, and alumni, who generally support Democratic candidates for office, the advancement of progressive ideals in American politics, and the improvement of the Democratic Party.

name: MIT Divest
mission: Our goal is to get MIT to cut all ties with the fossil fuel industry, including but not limited to funding, research influence, and recruitment!

name: MIT Energy and Climate Club
mission: The MIT Energy and Climate Club connects students, alumni, and community members who are passionate about energy and climate change. From 2004 to 2024, the Energy Club has been MIT's central platform for discussions about energy at the world's leading technical institute. In the Fall of 2021, we expanded our work to include not only energy but also the fight to combat climate change, and the intersection of these two subject areas. As the club with the largest reach on campus, we are a hub for thought-leadership and relationship building. Join our powerful community today.

name: MIT Entrepreneurship Club
mission: We provide MIT students with a community of students who are currently founders or are dedicated to become founders at some point in the future. Additionally, we help connect MIT students passionate about entrepreneurship to opportunities to further their career in the world of startups.

name: MIT Every Nation Campus (ENC)
mission: Welcome to Every Nation Campus – where open minds meet open hearts. We're a discussion-based Christian group open to all. Rejecting clichés, we dive into life's toughest questions while embracing our creativity. We believe in a God who made us not just to think, but to create, enjoy and have fun. Join us for lively discussions, warm fellowship, and weekly dinners.

name: MIT Film Makers Association
mission: MIT Film Makers Association provides unprecedented opportunities of film production and artistic expression for MIT students, staff and alumni. We are a welcoming and loving community for cinephiles, movie critics, filmmakers and potential filmmakers at MIT, Harvard, and all other colleges/schools around Boston. We provide opportunities for members to create films, meet other creators, and learn more about filmmaking through events and workshops.

name: MIT Flow
mission: Flow is a traditional Chinese dance team on MIT’s campus, established Fall 2023. We are dedicated to exploring and sharing the beauty of Chinese traditional, ethnic, and folk dance styles. Our goals are to provide a supportive community on MIT’s campus to learn diverse styles, as well as share traditional Chinese dance through performances within the MIT community and the greater Boston area.

name: MIT Forecasting Group
mission: The purpose of MIT Forecasting Group is to help the MIT community become more calibrated and better at forecasting future events.

name: MIT Gala
mission: The MIT Gala is a space to celebrate visual arts at MIT through an end-of-year event with a runway and art gallery, as well as supporting those in the MIT community interested in fashion through the process of designing and fabricating a piece to be shown off on the runway.

name: MIT Georgian Society
mission: Our mission is to raise awareness about Georgia and Georgian culture.

name: MIT Global Health Alliance
mission: The ultimate mission of the MIT Global Health Alliance is to educate and advocate for health equity and social justice in a global context. We aim to do so via partnerships with local and international organizations and community educational campaign efforts. In particular, we engage with the community through boothing on MIT’s campus, hosting global health-related courses for MIT Educational Studies Programs, organizing panels with experts in the field, and biweekly presentations given to our club general body. Our international partnerships have focused on addressing specific areas of need identified in conjunction with organization stakeholders in the form of a sustained, multi-year project. Our club emphasizes the importance of long term commitments to communities and partnerships, and through our efforts we uphold our values of inclusivity, advocacy, empathy, and integrity.

name: MIT Guild of Bellringers
mission: The purpose of the Guild is to promote and perpetuate the art of bell ringing and to provide an opportunity for its members to participate and improve in the group ringing of tower bells and hand bells.

name: MIT Informatics Tournament Club
mission: We, the members of the MIT Informatics Tournament Club (M(IT)^2), in order to spearhead initiatives for the M(IT)^2 tournament, to foster a worldwide community of competitive programmers anchored at MIT, to establish a fair system of appointing leadership, and to give all members a voice in organizational matters, hereby ordain and institute this Constitution.

name: MIT Israel Alliance
mission: The purpose of the MIT Israel Alliance is to promote and advocate for the safety and freedom of the Jewish people, as well as the State of Israel, through educative action and cultural events within MIT and throughout Massachusetts.The MIT Israel Alliance will promote the above goal as consistent with MIT Policies Regarding Student Behavior and all applicable law.

name: MIT Kendo Club
mission: The purpose of the MIT Kendo Club is to learn and practice kendo. Through the practice of kendo, we learn to mold the mind and body, cultivate a vigorous spirit, strive for improvement in the art of kendo, hold in esteem human courtesy and honor, associate with others with sincerity, and forever pursue the cultivation of oneself.

name: MIT Latin Dance Club
mission: To build a community of people who like Latin Dancing!

name: MIT LIVE
mission: MIT LIVE aims to provide a platform for MIT student musicians to arrange music, rehearse together, perform live, and showcase their talents. We welcome a variety of genres and instruments. Member can see their vision come to fruition through the delivery of a song during our end-of-semester showcases. Members may wish to start side projects, such as cover videos, original compositions, street performances, etc. and we will support them with our resources.

name: MIT Minority Association of Pre-Medical Students
mission: The mission of the Minority Association of Pre-Medical Students (M.A.P.S.) shall be to address the needs of the minority pre-health students at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. M.I.T.M.A.P.S. intends to motivate, encourage and prepare pre-health students from a disadvantaged background, an underrepresented minority group or a medically underserved area to be competitive applicants for health professional schools through a sharing of knowledge, experience and mentorship. The chapter is dedicated to serving underserved communities through a variety of community service activities and volunteering and to improve minority matriculation into all professional health related programs.

name: MIT Model United Nations
mission: The mission of the MIT Model United Nations club is to create opportunities for students to develop their professional debate and research skills, applied in an engaging political and social context.

name: MIT Nordic Club
mission: The MIT Nordic Club aims to bring together Nordic students at MIT, foster a sense of community, and celebrate the Nordic cultures through events and gatherings.

name: MIT Nritya
mission: MIT Nritya's mission is to foster a collaborative environment for Indian Classical Dance enthusiasts on campus to bond over their shared passion for dance. We hope to showcase the group's talent both through performances on campus and performances in the Greater Boston Area (and beyond) for the broader community.

name: MIT Pre-Law Society
mission: The MIT Pre-Law Society provides pre-law students with opportunities, resources, and a collaborative community to succeed in law school and legal careers. As one of MIT’s only law-focused student groups, we support aspiring lawyers through networking events, law school application assistance, and professional development initiatives.

name: MIT QuestBridge Scholars Network
mission: The MIT QuestBridge Scholars Network (QSN) Chapter is affiliated with QuestBridge (QB), a national non-profit organization that connects high-achieving, low-income high school students with admission and full scholarships to the nation’s best colleges. MIT’s QSN Chapter strives to create a supportive, engaging, and welcoming community for our 230+ QuestBridge Scholars who we often call Questies! Throughout the year, we arrange social events, foster friendships, and provide on-campus resources and mentorship.

name: MIT ROTC Association
mission: The MIT ROTC Association (MIT ROTCA) is dedicated to fostering a unified community for MIT students involved in ROTC across all programs. Our mission is to provide a student-led, cross-branch support network that promotes leadership development, mentorship, and camaraderie among cadets and midshipmen.MIT ROTCA serves as a bridge between ROTC students and the broader MIT community, facilitating interdisciplinary discussions, professional development opportunities, and outreach initiatives that enhance civil-military engagement on campus. Through collaborative events, service projects, and social gatherings, MIT ROTCA aims to strengthen the ROTC experience at MIT while providing an inclusive space for students interested in military service and leadership.

name: MIT Saudi Students Association
mission: Supporting the holistic growth of Saudi students by advocating for their needs, celebrating our heritage, and providing essential resources for academic and professional success

name: MIT Science Policy Review
mission: The MIT Science Policy Review is a researcher-run publication founded in 2019 whose primary purpose is to publish accessible and authoritative science policy reviews authored by members of the broader scientific community for dissemination to the wider public. Additionally, the MIT Science Policy Review aims to be a resource for local, state, federal, and international policymakers who are involved in the creation and funding of science policies, especially those that are highly technical in subject matter.The Review is partially funded by MIT and the MIT Technology and Policy Program. The views and opinions expressed in publications are solely those of the authors and do not reflect the official position of MIT, the MIT Science Policy Review, or any affiliated/funding organization.

name: MIT Student Veterans Association
mission: To provide a supportive community for veterans and service members at MIT through direct advocacy, disseminating helpful information, and hosting social events.

name: MIT Sustainability Summit
mission: To convene a diverse range of leaders –  from industry, academia, and students – and leverage MIT's unique interdisciplinary strengths to address pressing sustainability challenges.  Through collaboration and innovation, the Summit aims to empower participants to design and implement solutions that ensure a just, equitable, and thriving future for both humanity and the planet.

name: MIT Ukrainian Folk Dance Ensemble
mission: The MIT Ukrainian Folk Dance Ensemble aims to spread information about Ukrainian culture and heritage to the Boston and MIT communities.

name: MIT Wind Club
mission: The purpose of the MIT Wind is to promote wind energy education and outreach within MIT and in the greater Boston community. The goal educational component of MIT Wind is to prepare students with the skills and connections to enter the wind energy industry. For undergraduate members, the centerpiece of MIT Wind is participation in the Department of Energy Collegiate Wind Competition (CWC), an annual event in which the objective is to build an operational model turbine to compete against other collegiate teams. Graduate students and non-student members in MIT Wind can serve as mentors to the CWC team. Additionally, all members join a network of professional connections to industry leaders, faculty, and renewable energy centers like the MIT Energy Initiative. MIT Wind facilitates networking events, wind farm site tours, and other professional development activities. Finally, MIT Wind serves as a platform for organizing K-12 educational outreach as well as community outreach regarding wind energy.

name: MITALY - Italian Student Association
mission: At MITaly, we are a vibrant community of Italian students and scholars at MIT, united by a shared heritage and a passion for connection. Our mission is to celebrate and promote Italian culture, traditions, and values within the MIT ecosystem through social gatherings, cultural festivities, and academic networking. We strive to create a supportive environment where members can feel at home, forge lasting friendships, and collaborate across disciplines. By honoring our roots and embracing diversity, we aim to build bridges between Italy and the global MIT community.

name: MITap
mission: MITap is a tap company dedicated to spreading the art of tap dance on MIT’s campus and across the Boston/Cambridge area. We are committed to training in tap technique and performing tap dance.

name: MITeri
mission: 1. To strengthen the Nepali community within MIT and the bigger Boston area2. To celebrate with and represent Nepali culture and traditions to MIT community members.

name: MITVote
mission: MITvote is a nonpartisan group of graduates and undergraduates with the goal of engaging an active voter community on campus. Our mission is to make voting as accessible as possible for everyone and encourage civic participation on MIT's campus.

name: MITxHarvard Women in AI
mission: We are a club of MIT and Harvard students who are interested in artificial intelligence and machine learning. We use an inclusive definition of the word women, and the purpose of the Women in Artificial Intelligence group is to provide a supportive community for cisgender women, transgender women, genderqueer women and individuals, and non-binary individuals pursuing studies or research in AI and machine learning at MIT and Harvard.

name: MIXED
mission: To provide a community for students who are of a mixed heritage and experience. We aim to create space for students to embrace their cultures and the complexities of the intersection of multiple identities, to increase awareness of the diversity of the mixed experience, and to discuss mixed issues.

name: Mobin
mission: The purpose of the Mobin student group is to promote understanding of “Shia Islam”.

name: Mocha Moves Dance Squad
mission: Established in 1999, Mocha Moves is an MIT-based dance team whose mission is to be a creative outlet for members to develop their skills. We share our talent and passion for dance through hosting performances, such as Ring the Alarm and Mocha Show, and participating in many others hosted throughout the Greater Boston Area. We strive to learn and grow together by cultivating our talents and connections with the Boston dance community. On Mocha, the grind never stops!

name: Mock Trial Team
mission: MIT Mock Trial is a student organization which competes under the American Mock Trial Association (AMTA). Members develop skills in public speaking, debate, legal understanding, acting, and more through tournaments throughout the year.

name: Mongolian Student Association
mission: Mongolian Students Association's mission is to promote Mongolian culture at MIT. We’re determined to bring Mongolian students closer together and to support them through their journey at MIT, helping them through many challenges such as culture shock and homesickness.

name: moveMENtality
mission: The purpose of the moveMENtality is to create a space for male-identifying students to experiment with and explore dance at MIT. Our membership is composed of students who are interested in dance, whether or not they have had dance experience before college. We choreograph and practice a new performance each semester, and perform at showcases such as Ring the Alarm, Footwork, and DT Shows.

name: Mujeres Latinas
mission: We are a group at MIT who focus on creating community for other Latinas at MIT. We want to promote service, knowledge, and identity to our community.

name: Muses
mission: The MIT Muses are an all-treble a cappella group comprised of students (both undergraduate and graduate) at MIT. The Muses sing a minimum of two concerts per year: one during the fall and another in the spring. Additionally we perform in two campus-wide performances each year, the Fall family weekend concert and the Spring CPW concert. We also sing at various gigs both on and off campus throughout the year. The Muses also do an annual fundraiser on Valentine’s Day in which we serenade various members of the MIT community.

name: Music Production Collaborative
mission: We promote the collaboration, education, and exchange of ideas among MIT community members interested in all aspects of music production.

name: Musical Theatre Guild
mission: The MIT Musical Theatre Guild is the oldest and largest theatre organization at MIT, and we are entirely student-run! Formed from the merger of the MIT Gilbert and Sullivan Society, the Classical Musical Society, and the Tech Show Society in 1971, we produce a wide variety of Musical Theatre. We perform four shows a year so there is plenty of opportunity to act, sing, dance, tech, design, direct, and produce. So, if you want to be part of a great art form, come investigate MTG!

name: Muslim Students Association
mission: The MIT Muslim Student Association (MSA) seeks to foster a welcoming, spiritually enriching, and intellectually vibrant community for Muslims and non-Muslims alike at MIT. We are dedicated to supporting the religious, academic, and personal development of students through inclusive programming that reflects the values of Islam. Our mission is to cultivate meaningful spaces for worship, dialogue, learning, and social engagement, while striving to build bridges of understanding between Muslims and the broader MIT community. Through service, mentorship, and collaboration, we aim to empower Muslims at MIT and positively contribute to the Institute and the greater Boston area in a manner rooted in Islamic principles and guided by the prophetic tradition​.

name: National Society of Black Engineers
mission: To increase the number of culturally responsible Black Engineers who excel academically, succeed professionally and positively impact the community

name: Native American & Indigenous Association
mission: The Native American & Indigenous Association seeks to provide social, political, cultural and academic support for Massachusetts Institute of Technology undergraduate and graduate students of Native American descent and Native student allies. NAIA allows Native American students to connect with similar students through their cultural history and individual experiences as Indigenous people. This goal encompasses the development of members as future leaders and mentors of Native Americans and will provide a network to allow discussion and innovative problem solving on the issues faced by Indigenous peoples. NAIA also seeks to educate the MIT community on facets of Native American life and ensure that the community and its leadership maintain MIT as an equitable and secure place for Native American students and all students of color.

name: Next Act
mission: The purpose of Next Act shall be to produce and present an annual full-length musical production during MIT’s Campus Preview Weekend (CPW) and to serve as a portal into the world of musical theater for veterans and beginners alike. Anyone who auditions for a Next Act production is guaranteed to be cast in a speaking and/or singing role, regardless of experience.

name: Next Sing
mission: The mission of Next Sing is to provide a fun, noncompetitive, low commitment music activity for all MIT students interested in music. We welcome all musicians––singers and instrumentalists, undergrads and grad students––to join! We accept people of all skill levels and backgrounds. Our musical acts all involve vocalists and sometimes instrumentalists.

name: Ninja Warrior Club
mission: Our club intends to bring an alternative sport to MIT.MIT ninja warriors will train for ninja warrior obstacles such as those straight from the American Ninja Warrior Obstacle courses. It is for both beginners who want to maintain fitness and have fun learning cool tricks and obstacles, as well as the more experienced ninja whose goal is to train ninja competitively.

name: Ohms
mission: To celebrate our love of South Asian culture and music across the world by writing and performing fusion a capella arrangements.

name: Open Discourse Society
mission: The purpose of the MIT Open Discourse Society (MODS) is to cultivate civil discourse and intellectual diversity within the MIT community. MIT is the global STEM epicenter, and for so long, advancements in science and technology here and elsewhere have stemmed from the willingness to engage in productive discussions and good-faith evaluation of ideas.MODS aims to recreate environments where such discussions and evaluation are the norm and devoid of bigoted obloquy. Such environments range from speaker events and panel discussions to roundtables and workshops to networking events that connect students with professionals who have taken a stand for free speech.In this era where censorship and crackdowns dominate, it is more important than ever to uphold the integrity of open inquiry that is embedded within MIT's long-standing tradition of creativity and curiosity and the broader nature of the scientific process. MODS exists precisely for this purpose.

name: OpenCode Club
mission: Elevate open source culture within MIT and break down obstacles to information and technology

name: OrigaMIT
mission: The purpose of OrigaMIT is to provide current origami artists a place to meet others who share the same passion, and to provide new or interested folders an opportunity to learn.

name: Origins
mission: Our mission at MIT Origins is to foster holistic well-being within the MIT community by offering a diverse range of activities, including yoga, Vedic spiritual wisdom, nourishing dinners, spiritual festival celebrations, enriching workshops, engaging weekly discussions, retreats, and more. We are committed to nurturing the body, mind, and spirit, guiding individuals towards greater fulfillment and balance in their lives.

name: Orthodox Christian Fellowship of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology
mission: Our mission is 1) to be the loving presence of Christ and the Orthodox Christian Church on college campuses, 2) to be an integral part of students’ spiritual formation by challenging them to explore the Faith, 3) to inspire students to commit to living an Orthodox Christian way of life daily.

name: OSU!MIT
mission: The purpose of osu!mit is to share interest in the free-to-play music game osu!, to provide a friendly environment for students to connect with others outside of academics, and to motivate and compete in various tournaments within the game such as the "osu! Collegiate League". The osu! community at MIT is special because of our derived, shared interest in topics such as different genres of music, interactive music systems, and level design.

name: Outing Club
mission: The purpose of MITOC shall be to create a safe community around outdoor recreation and to provide students with the education and means to use, enjoy, and explore the great outdoors.

name: Palestine at MIT
mission: At Palestine@MIT, we are dedicated to promoting the Palestinian heritage, tradition and culture. We embrace our identity and our values are rooted in the our rich history of striving for freedom and liberation. We believe we own tomorrow. Tomorrow is a Palestinian day.

name: Paraguayan Association
mission: The purpose of the MIT Paraguayan Association is to provide a welcoming and supportive community for current Paraguayan students, creating a home away from home. The club promotes Paraguayan culture within MIT through events, cultural exchanges, and fostering a sense of unity among Paraguayan members. It aims to increase awareness of Paraguayan traditions and values, while offering a network of mutual support, academic collaboration, and personal growth for its members.

name: PLEASURE at MIT
mission: PLEASURE is a student group at MIT supported by the Violence Prevention &Response (VPR) office and the Office for Student Wellbeing (OSW) that aims toimprove how our communities navigate sex and relationships in order to end sexual andall forms of identity-based violence through peer education.

name: Pokemon League
mission: The purpose of MIT Pokémon League is to (1) promote an MIT studentcommunity that appreciates and plays a variety of Pokémon games and (2)establish a Pokémon League at MIT, which will be officially recognized by thePlay! Pokémon organization.

name: Poker Club
mission: The purpose of this club is to create a community with like interests and also create a better understanding in the game of poker.

name: Pokerbots
mission: Pokerbots' main purpose is to run the annual MIT Pokerbots class and competition during IAP, including teaching all of our students and securing sponsorship funding for the competition prizes.

name: Polish Club
mission: Bringing Polish culture and community to MIT – celebrating traditions, fostering connections, and sharing opportunities for cultural engagement.

name: Polymer Graduate Student Association
mission: The mission of the Polymer Graduate Student Association (hereafter referred to as PGSA) is to facilitate social and academic interaction among PPSM (Program in Polymer Science and Soft Matter) students, as well as promote the well-being and vitality of the program to maintain its status as a forum for interdepartmental polymer research.

name: PreMedical Society
mission: Foster community within pre-health students at MIT and prepare members for a career in medicine.

name: ProLife
mission: The MIT Pro-Life Club is focused on spreading awareness about the risks about abortion, about the philosophies against abortion, providing resources to women who are considering getting, currently getting, or have gotten an abortion. The MIT Pro-Life Club is also focused on working with local and national organizations that assist in the aforementioned efforts.

name: Puzzle Club
mission: The purpose of the organization is to promote interest and participation in puzzles on campus, through solving and writing puzzles, as well as running various events and meetings throughout the year. The flagship event is the annual MIT Mystery Hunt (“the Hunt”), a weekend long activity held during IAP in which teams of participants compete to solve a variety of puzzles and find a coin hidden on campus.

name: Quiz Bowl Team
mission: The MIT Quiz Bowl Team is an organization of MIT undergraduate and graduate students who compete in and host academic trivia (i.e. quizbowl) competitions. The purpose of the MIT Quiz Bowl Team is to promote and encourage participation in quiz bowl events, academic competitions, and trivia games, and the accumulation of trivial knowledge; to host on-campus and interscholastic quiz bowl tournaments; and to recruit, train, and support the quiz bowl teams which represent MIT in intercollegiate competition.

name: Radio Society W1MX
mission: The purpose of the Society shall be to gather together the students of MIT having an interest in amateur radio. The Society will endeavor to maintain an HF (Below 30MHz) Amateur Radio Station for the use of its members, both in individual activities and with the intent of promoting the image of MIT throughout the world via amateur radio.

name: Reading for Revolution
mission: Reading for Revolution (R4R) is a group of students at MIT seeking to understand the contemporary conditions of America, its geopolitical relations with the world (particularly the ‘Global South’), and our responsibility as citizens, students, and engineers to create a more just and human-oriented society. In our meetings, we discuss questions such as: how do we develop a culture which prioritizes the inherent right of all people to a decent livelihood? What is true democracy? What is the role of technology and art in advancing the freedom struggle? We look for answers through studying the revolutionary life and legacy of figures such as W. E. B. Du Bois, Martin Luther King Jr., Grace Lee and James Boggs, James Baldwin, and Malcolm X, as well as global liberation movements which sought to free humanity from imperialism, poverty, and all other forms of exploitation. Through speaker events and collaborations with other MIT political and cultural groups, we seek to bring discussions of these questions to light within the broader MIT community.

name: Reformed University Fellowship
mission: RUF is a community that is committed to considering the good news of Jesus together. We seek to be an authentic community that is supportive, spiritually challenging, and outward facing to our peers on campus. RUF is a safe place to ask questions, voice doubts and explore Christianity with other students at MIT.

name: Resonance of MIT
mission: The purpose of The Resonance of MIT is to provide an outlet to sing a cappella non-competitively at MIT. The Resonance will strive to maintain a low key and fun atmosphere. We will keep required time commitment to such a level as to allow members to be active participants in other activities (especially performance groups) at MIT.

name: Ribotones
mission: The MIT Ribotones is a music service group that aims to use music as a means of community service in the greater Boston community and beyond. We are string/piano/wind players, vocalists, and chamber groups (e.g., trios, quartets, sextets, octets) who love to play volunteer recitals at local venues such as hospitals, nursing homes, long-term care facilities, and more, delivering quality music to the residents. Our primary goal is to bring the joy of music free of charge to those who may have limited access to live performances, no matter their prior experience with music.

name: Ridonkulous
mission: Established in spring 2005, Ridonkulous is an urban dance crew whose goal is to bring MIT dance to other venues in the greater Boston area and to express our passion and commitment to teamwork and dance. In addition to performing at charity events, collegiate showcases, and competitions across the Greater Boston area, we host our own annual showcase, Footwork. Our mission is to have fun, dance, and show the world why we are so RIDONKULOUS!

name: Roadkill Buffet
mission: An Improv Comedy troupe which exists to bring joy to the MIT community through our public and free performances, as well as to improve and enhance the craft of our troupe members.

name: Robotics Team
mission: The MIT Robotics Team is a group of highly motivated undergraduate students from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Our diverse group, with majors ranging from Mechanical Engineering to Business Analytics, shares a common passion for the field of robotics. The team’s purpose is to explore exciting new technologies, learn critical skills, and promote the field of robotics through entering a variety of competitions and engaging in outreach events in the wider community.

name: Rocket Team
mission: We will design, build, test, launch, and recover a rocket — flying an engaging scientific experiment — beyond the Kármán Line.

name: ROCSA
mission: ROCSA (stands for Republic of China (Taiwan) Student Association) is the official graduate student organization of Taiwanese students at MIT. We host events for students who share common cultural roots and help promote Taiwanese culture to the entire student community. Our mission is for students from all backgrounds to share their interests and roots, help promote the Taiwanese culture to those who are interested, and connect the members of the MIT Taiwanese student community.

name: Romanian Student Association
mission: The mission of the Romanian Student Association is to bring together Romanianstudents at MIT and give them a place to celebrate their culture, as well as introduce other members of the MIT community to Romanian culture.

name: Rune
mission: Our mission is to provide a creative and artistic outlet for the MIT community to showcase and publish their work.

name: Russian Connection
mission: The purpose of the Russian Connection is to unite and bring the MIT Russian-speaking community as well as anyone interested in experiencing Russian/Eastern European culture together outside of research.

name: Sakata Afrique
mission: The purpose of Sakata Afrique is to help MIT students of African and Caribbean originor descent preserve their cultural heritage through music and dance, and to introduceAfro-Caribbean dance to the MIT community.

name: Sangam
mission: 1. Enriching the MIT environment with the culture and traditions of the Indian subcontinent.2. Providing forums for both learned and casual discussion of issues relevant to the subcontinent and the people whose roots are there.3. Working with MIT and our partner organizations to ensure that the total needs of the General Sangam Body are met.

name: SaveTFP
mission: SaveTFP is committed to reducing stress and facilitating student social activities while increasing health awareness and curbing dangerous behaviors at MIT.

name: Scholars of Finance
mission: The purpose of the Scholars of Finance is to develop the next generation of highly capable financial executives, who will act and lead from a strong grounding in principles and ethics.

name: Science Bowl
mission: The purpose of MIT Science Bowl is to promote science education and exposure to the K-12 community via the organization of at least two buzzer-style competitions. These competitions are the Fall Invitational, catering to high-school teams across the nation, and the Spring Regional, the official National Science Bowl regional competition for the Northeast Region.

name: Science Club for Girls at MIT
mission: The mission of Science Club for Girls at MIT is to foster excitement, confidence, and literacy in STEM for girls and gender-expansive youth from underrepresented communities by providing free, experiential programs and by maximizing meaningful interactions with women-in-STEM mentors. Girls work with mentor-scientists who model and foster leadership and promote careers in science and technology as goals and options.  Science Club for Girls will work to create a community of MIT undergraduate and graduate students dedicated to serving local Cambridge and Boston schools and generating enthusiasm for science through after school and extracurricular activities. Science Club for Girls fulfills a need at MIT for a volunteering opportunity that empowers future women scientists, and it fulfills a need of the Cambridge community for free and educational after school opportunities.

name: Science Fiction Society
mission: The primary purpose of the Society shall be the maintenance, operation, and expansion of the Society's library of speculative fiction. The secondary purpose of the Society shall be to encourage academic and social activities related to speculative fiction, and to provide a forum for such activities.

name: Science Olympiad at MIT
mission: Science Olympiad at MIT is a group of undergraduate students that organizes an annual Science Olympiad invitational as an alumni chapter of the National Science Olympiad organization. We provide around 1000 high school students with the opportunity to engage in a variety of topics in science and engineering.

name: Science Policy Initiative
mission: The MIT Science Policy Initiative, founded in 2007, is a group of postdocs, graduate, and undergraduate students who work closely with the MIT DC Office and other science policy advocates to foster discourse between the scientists of tomorrow and policy-makers of today.We believe that early career scientists and engineers can benefit by learning about and engaging with the world of science policy and legislation, and provide opportunities and resources to do so. Postdocs and students in our programs not only learn how our national leaders make and legislate their science policies, but also get valuable on-the-Hill advocacy experience.

name: Scuba Club
mission: The MIT Scuba Club aims to provide a central hub for students, faculty, staff, and other members of the Boston area interested in scuba diving to interact, plan dive trips, and foster their knowledge of underwater exploration.

name: Shakespeare Ensemble
mission: The MIT Shakespeare Ensemble is a self-sustaining community dedicated to bringing the works of Shakespeare and other playwrights to life. We are a group of students and community members who are committed to forming an open and fun-loving team focused on learning the various aspects of theater. We share a common interest in the idea of the theater ensemble: a group of people who work together on a long-term basis to produce shows.Everyone is welcome to come learn and explore with us, from first time techies to experienced actors. The Ensemble performs four mainstage shows every year during the fall term, IAP, the spring term, and the summer. Our term shows are usually Shakespearean plays directed by a hired professional director. The IAP and summer shows are usually student-directed, and we often branch out to other playwrights. We also perform Scene Nights (performances of short scenes from any play) and 24 Hour Shows (during which we write and rehearse a show all within 24 hours!) the year. Everything from acting to tech is entirely student-run, creating an excellent atmosphere in which to try your hand at new skills.

name: SHINE for Girls
mission: Our goal is to promote both academic and artistic development in young girls and non-binary students through mentoring math, dance, and creative arts.

name: SIAM
mission: The purpose of the MIT SIAM (Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics) chapter is to engage the diverse MIT community with a shared interest in Applied Mathematics and Computational Science. We seek to further SIAM’s mission to bridge the world of mathematics with that of science and technology. Our group aims to encourage interdisciplinary collaboration, and facilitate exchange of ideas and scientific results.

name: Singapore Students Society
mission: The Singapore Students Society, hereinafter referred to as the “Society,” is a solely cultural club with the following purposes: to foster friendship among students interested in Singapore culture and to promote cultural exchange between Singapore students at MIT and students from other countries in Massachusetts.

name: Sloan Business Club
mission: Sloan Business Club (SBC) empowers students with the skills, network, and experience to excel in finance, consulting, and entrepreneurship.

name: Smash UltiMIT
mission: The purpose of Smash UltiMIT is to maintain a centralized community of competitive Super Smash Bros players by hosting tournaments.

name: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
mission: SHPE (Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers) is a nonprofit organization serving and advancing Hispanics in STEM. With more than 13,000 student and professional members, SHPE’s mission is to change lives by empowering the Hispanic community to realize its fullest potential and to impact the world through STEM awareness, access, support, and development. To accomplish this, SHPE provides a variety of programming, services, resources, and events, including hosting the largest Hispanic STEM convention in the nation.

name: Society of Physics Students
mission: To provide information and service in the interest of the members of MIT community who are interested in physics and to encourage interaction between undergraduate students, graduate students, faculty, staff, and other members of MIT community interested in physics.

name: Society of Women Engineers
mission: MIT Society of Engineers was founded in 1979. Since then, MIT SWE has strived to inspire younger generations about engineering, encourage the notion of diversity in engineering, and determine and advocate for the needs of women engineers at MIT and the broader community.

name: South Asian Association of Students
mission: MIT's South Asian Association of Students (SAAS) is one of the largest groups on campus, dedicated to promoting South Asian culture and creating spaces for students of South Asian descent at MIT. SAAS is open to all students interested in getting a taste of South Asian culture. Our organization was founded with the purpose of celebrating the diversity of South Asian culture and providing spaces for discourse and community among people with ties to that culture. SAAS provides space to celebrate South Asian culture in big ways, engage in discourse about that culture and the ways it affects our society, and to bond with other community members over shared experiences, values, and traditions. Through this, we hope to create a more positive and impactful South Asian presence at MIT.

name: South Slavic Association
mission: The purpose of the SSA is to be a home for all students with either an interest in South Slavic culture and history, or students with a South Slavic background interested in connecting with other South Slavs. The SSA aims to connect the many American South Slavs, International South Slavic students, as well as friends and generally interested students in the culture. The group will work to be a source of connection in a network of such students and promote student mental health and interaction the through organization of cultural events.The group will aim at all times to remain a positive, open, and supportive atmosphere based on understanding the cultural complexities of the South Slavic and general Balkan region, as well as first and foremost promoting unity through wonderful food, music and dances.

name: Southeast Asia Society
mission: The mission of the MIT Southeast Asian Society is to foster positive professional and personal relationships between its members and the various Southeast Asian country societies through social events and to raise awareness of the culture and opportunities in the Southeast Asia region to the entire MIT community.

name: Spain at MIT
mission: To bring the Spaniards at MIT together, and to share their culture with the rest of the MIT community

name: Spinning Arts Club
mission: The purpose of the MIT Spinning Arts Club is to provide students with a venue in which to learn and practice prop spinning for both fire and glow props, as well as access to instruction in both performance and safety with fire.

name: Sporting Clays Association
mission: The MIT Sporting Clays Association is a competitive shotgun shooting team. We practice on flying targets in the disciplines of Skeet, Trap, and Sporting Clays. The sport takes a tremendous amount of discipline and helps members to improve their mental focus as well as hand-eye coordination. Additionally, the club teaches its members how to safely and respectfully handle firearms while introducing them to a sport that plays a significant role in American culture.

name: Sri Lankan Students Association
mission: The Sri Lanka Student's Association at MIT is dedicated to fostering a vibrant community that celebrates and promotes Sri Lankan culture while nurturing a supportive environment for its members. Our mission is to cultivate cultural awareness, facilitate open dialogue and connection among Sri Lankan and non-Sri Lankan students, and provide unwavering support for Sri Lankans at MIT. Through diverse events, discussions, and support initiatives, we aim to enrich the MIT experience for all members, promote cross-cultural understanding, and contribute positively to the campus community.

name: Stammtisch
mission: Stammtisch is a club dedicated to bringing together those who share an interest in the German language and culture.

name: Stand-Up CoMITy
mission: The purpose of Stand-Up CoMITy is to promote student mental health and wellbeing through comedy, as well as provide a platform for students and staff to ideate, write, and perform stand-up comedy as a means of self-expression.

name: StartLabs
mission: Foster the next generation of technical entrepreneurs by helping MIT students learn about startups and launch innovative ventures.

name: Strategic Games Society
mission: At MIT SGS (Strategic Games Society), our mission is to unite board game enthusiasts from MIT and the Boston-Cambridge area. Our focus lies in having fun, fostering connections, and ensuring that MIT SGS continues to be the longest-standing board game club at MIT.

name: Student Information Processing Board
mission: Our mission is to provide students with improved access to computational facilities; to serve as an advocate for the MIT Community to the Faculty and the Administration in computer-related topics; to function as an information center for members of the MIT Community interested in topics in computer science or computing; to conduct, manage, and support experiments run by students to advance the techniques of organization, planning, and administration of access to computers; and to initiate, develop, and provide computer services deemed valuable to the MIT Community.

name: Student Juggling Club
mission: 1. To educate students about the art of juggling.2. To provide students with the chance to learn from other jugglers.

name: Student Sustainability Coalition
mission: Established in the summer of 2020, the Student Sustainability Coalition (SSC) congregates student sustainability-related groups at MIT, facilitating communication, collaboration, and collective action. Given the diversity of student sustainability organizations and opportunities on campus, we aim to act as a centralized overarching organization, making connections between groups and elevating the student voice.

name: Students for the Exploration and Development of Space
mission: SEDS is an independent, student-based, student-run organization which promotes the exploration and development of space. SEDS pursues this mission by educating people about the benefits of space, by supporting a network of interested students, by providing an opportunity for members to develop their leadership skills, and inspiring people through our involvement in space-related projects. SEDS believes in a space-faring civilization and that focusing the enthusiasm of young people is the key to our future in space.

name: Students of Open and Universal Learning
mission: The purpose of SOUL is to accelerate, experiment with, and build a stronger culture of open education at institutions of higher education, starting with MIT.

name: Sudanese@MIT
mission: Sudanese@MIT is a group that focuses on connecting the MIT Sudanese community to the wider student body, Sudanese alumni, and the greater Boston/Cambridge area. We aim to create a space where Sudanese students can share their culture and connect with their peers.

name: Swara
mission: MIT Swara is the Indian Classical Music Group at MIT with a focus on South Indian Carnatic music. We gather weekly to jam together and learn new pieces collectively out of a shared passion for this unique style of music. We welcome people at all levels to learn and perform together, both at MIT events and at event we organize for the MIT community. Our mission is to connect musicians at MIT to each other and to the thriving Carnatic music ecosystem in the greater Boston area.

name: Syncopasian
mission: Syncopasian is a co-ed a-cappella group at MIT with an emphasis on modern East Asian music. Since our founding in Spring 2008, we have put on many successful performances while supporting a vibrant and cross-cultural space for our members and audiences. Our goals as a group are as follows: (1) to sustain our musical presence by recording and producing music videos, and (2) to raise awareness for East Asian music and culture, both within MIT and the Greater Boston/Cambridge community

name: Taara
mission: Taara (meaning: Star) aims to provide a dynamic platform that empowers and elevates the voices of South Asian women, femme, and gender non-conforming students at MIT. Through advocacy, activism, and action, we are committed to challenging systemic barriers that hinder our access to opportunity, representation, and well-being.

name: Tango Club
mission: The purpose of the MIT Tango Club is promoting Argentine Tango to the MIT Community. We offer classes, practice sessions (called "practicas"), introductory bootcamps, and workshops at heavily discounted prices for MIT students.

name: Tech Catholic Community
mission: Vision:  A vibrant, Catholic community at MIT empowering leaders in faith and science.  Mission:  Welcome, Grow, Worship

name: Tech Model Railroad Club
mission: The purpose of the Club shall be to increase the awareness of model railroading among M.I.T. students and other members of the M.I.T. community. The Club shall organize and administer facilities to promote the hobby and encourage the participation of the M.I.T. community.

name: Tech Squares
mission: Tech Squares is a square dance and round dance group at MIT. We dance Plus squares and Phase II to V rounds once a week in addition to other events.

name: Technicolor Furs
mission: The purpose of the Technicolor Furs is:- To provide a welcoming environment for everyone in the MIT community to discuss, share, and participate in various aspects of the furry fandom- To promote awareness and appreciation of furries

name: Technique Yearbook
mission: Founded in 1885, MIT Technique aims to provide a venue for students' creative expression through photography and design, connect student photographers with events and opportunities around campus, and document student life as part of its award-winning yearbook.

name: Technology Policy Student Society
mission: In order to study and discuss issues in technology policy seminars, provide information about careers, engage in a dialogue with invited speakers, and participate in a community of open-minded students, we hereby form the Technology Policy Student Society (hereafter TPSS).

name: TechSec
mission: The mission statement of TechSec is to provide MIT students a safe haven to learn and cultivate theirknowledge on cybersecurity.

name: TechX
mission: The purpose of the MIT TechX student organization is to promote knowledge of technology and of the tech industry.

name: TEDxMIT
mission: The purpose of TEDxMIT is to organize and hold TEDx conferences to showcase the diverse perspectives of the MIT community. By inviting a wide variety of speakers to share their stories and talents, we hope to create an environment where students, faculty, and community members alike can learn from each other in a non-traditional setting.

name: Thai Students at MIT
mission: The purpose of the Thai students at MIT is to promote understanding of the Thai heritage and interaction among Thai students. The organization provides a comfortable space for all Thai students at MIT through different seasonal and cultural activities to make the community like home. Thai students at MIT also serve as a social network of Thai students as will bring Thai students from different universities in the Boston area together through the biannual event we organize every year. .

name: The Bike Lab
mission: The MIT Bike Lab is a student-run bike collective that provides services to the MIT community. Studentsvolunteer as mechanics to assist others with bike repair and maintenance. All members of thecommunity are welcome, and access to tools and advice is completely free of charge. The shop hasmost of the tools needed to complete basic repairs. The club is also an opportunity for people tobuild community around biking and safety, and for mechanics to hold educational workshops formembers of the community. The shop has been running for 2 months now. Currently, the shop is openon Fridays from 2-5PM outside Building 13. There are four active volunteer mechanics, and there aretypically 10-15 customers who come to open hours for assistance.

name: The F Word
mission: The MIT Monologues are an annual production put on by the F-Word @ MIT, centering marginalized and underrepresented identities’ experiences around gender, sexuality, physical / mental / emotional health, ethnicity, and more. if you have a story you would like to share, we would love to have you!

name: The Tech
mission: Providing MIT faculty, staff, and students with continuous news service since 1881.

name: Thirsty Ear Programming Committee
mission: The purpose of the Thirsty Ear Programming Committee (TEPC fka TEEC) is to provide student input and leadership for the Thirsty Ear Pub (TE).

name: Toons
mission: To provide a co-ed a cappella group with members from the Wellesley College and MIT communities.

name: Traders at MIT
mission: We partner with leading industry sponsors annually to host the largest intercollegiate trading competition in the country. In addition, we organize seminars and events to prepare students for successful careers in quantitative trading and finance.

name: TransMIT
mission: The purpose of TransMIT is to support the trans and gender expansive (i.e. identities including but not limited to: transgender, transsexual, gender non-conforming (GNC), genderqueer, two-spirit, agender, non-binary, and gender questioning) community at MIT. TransMIT will fulfill this purpose by:-Developing and hosting programming to further the social and professional development of its members,-Raising awareness of the existence and experiences of trans and gender expansive individuals at MIT,-Collecting and sharing resources that are relevant to the needs of the trans and gender expansive community at MIT,-Serving as an advocate for the needs of all trans individuals affected by MIT policy.

name: Turkish Student Association
mission: We are a group for all Turkish students and students interested in Turkish culture and Turkey. We host events pertaining to Turkish culture.

name: UHF Repeater Assn W1XM
mission: To engage with experimental radio technology in VHF, UHF, and beyond. Maintains an electrical engineering and radio-focused makerspace for MIT students to use to explore amateur radio technology and other electronics projects. Maintains the W1XM UHF repeater and the W1XM contest station, including operating the building 54 radome.

name: Ukraine@MIT
mission: The purpose of Ukraine@MIT is to band together the Ukrainians of MIT and those interested in Ukrainian culture and world events.

name: Ultimate PickUp
mission: The purpose of Ultimate Pickup is to organize casual ultimate frisbee games on campus for students, affiliates, and alumni to play together. This allows for more frisbee games than the spring IM season, and makes the sport more accessible to folks who do not have the time to play on the MIT club teams and IM teams.

name: Undergraduate Economics Association
mission: MIT UEA optimizes the academic journey, employment prospects, and interconnectedness of MIT undergraduates within both the MIT community and the broader world.

name: Undergraduate Mathematics Association
mission: The purpose of the Undergraduate Mathematics Association is to afford all MIT undergraduates the opportunity to explore mathematics, to build connections with other students and faculty who share an interest in mathematics, and to promote mathematics in the MIT community.

name: Undergraduate Research Journal
mission: The mission of MURJ is to serve as a vehicle for advancing scientific communication and responsible innovation by emphasizing the intersection of science and public policy. MURJ seeks to forge a network of readers, staff, and alumni to become the next generation of STEM leaders and provide a channel to inform the world of the impact of shared science.

name: Undergraduate Research Technology Club
mission: Bringing together undergraduates from around the world to present, discuss, and develop solutions to advance technology for humanity.

name: Undergraduate Society for Women in Mathematics
mission: The organization aims to provide a supportive and inclusive community for woman-identifying and non-binary individuals within the MIT undergraduate math department and hosts events open to the MIT undergraduate community at large. Through regular community events and meetings, the organization will serve as a means for the aforementioned group of math students to foster relationships with one another and to share a love of mathematics. The organization will help its members to explore potential career paths and research trajectories via collaborations with various companies and research groups. Additionally, the organization will work to promote inclusivity within mathematics by organizing events and programs, both for the MIT and greater Boston community.

name: Undergraduate Women in Physics
mission: The purpose of the Undergraduate Women in Physics is to be a student-led group that supports MIT undergraduate students seeking a space to talk about the experiences of being a woman and/or being coded as a woman in physics, while acknowledging the diversity among people who have had these experiences. We sponsor community building events, share resources, and host women in STEM related events throughout the semester.

name: Vedic Vision Forum
mission: Our mission is to foster holistic well-being and mindfulness among students by drawing from the timeless wisdom of spiritual philosophies. We aim to provide motivation, inspiration, and avenues for positive recreation, while encouraging personal growth through personality development and character building. Our organization is committed to guiding students away from self-destructive habits and addictions, and to nurturing principled, value-driven leaders with strong character and competence. We also seek to enrich the student experience by integrating arts, media, culture, and music into our educational initiatives.

name: Video Game Orchestra
mission: The MIT Video Game Orchestra is a student-led ensemble dedicated to playing original arrangements of video game music, film soundtracks, and all kinds of music not usually heard in concert halls. Made up of a mix of orchestral, band, and popular instruments, we play a wide variety of genres. All our arrangements are written by members of the orchestra and are tailored for the group, and we hold workshops to help members develop their arranging and orchestration skills. Outside of rehearsal, we have lots of fun too! :)We rehearse on Sundays 2-4pm in Kresge and/or the Student Center.

name: Video Gamers Alliance
mission: To bring all MIT Gaming related communities together and increase the opportunities for resources, engagement and outreach.

name: Vietnamese Students
mission: This group is to share Vietnamese cultures to MIT community.

name: Voltage
mission: The mission of Voltage (collectively, the organization) is to grow and develop the electrical engineering (EE) community at MIT. We seek to advance this mission by providing a community for MIT students interested in EE, fostering hands-on engineering experience, exposing them to industry trends within EE and providing them with career advice and growth opportunities. The cornerstones of the organization are community and mentorship.

name: VR/AR at MIT
mission: 1. CREATING THE VR / AR COMMUNITY.We're like-minded students, excited about VR/AR/MR. We meet and organize events for our community throughout Boston and organize the biggest Reality Hackathon in the WORLD.2. PROVIDING RESOURCES TO DEVELOPERSWe empower and provide students necessary workshops and hardware to learn and build the next generation of Virtual and Augmented Reality.3. BRINGING INDUSTRY TO CAMPUSWe bridge academia and industry by connecting students and masters. We draw from the expertise from alumni and industry champions.

name: Water Club
mission: MIT Water is the premier network for water research and innovation at MIT. Our mission is to bring together creative, passionate, and motivated individuals to explore ways by which research, innovation, and policy can help solve the most pressing challenges in the water sector.

name: WHOI Student Organization
mission: The purpose of the MIT/WHOI Student Organization is to encourage interaction between MIT students and the Woods Hole community, enhance student life, elevate student voices, and advocate on behalf of the student body of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology–Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (MIT-WHOI) Joint Program. The MIT-WHOI Joint Program in Oceanography/Applied Ocean Science and Engineering is a joint venture between the two institutions to pursue excellence in oceanographic research and education. MIT students in this program are often based in Woods Hole, which is over 80 miles from Cambridge. Beyond creating a student community at WHOI, this group will help keep WHOI-based students in touch with each other and with those based at MIT.

name: Women Business Leaders
mission: MIT Women Business Leaders establishes a network of women undergraduates, faculty, alumnae and professionals to empower women in their business endeavors and support them in the development of their careers. We support our members in their personal and professional pursuits during and after their years at MIT.

name: Women in Aerospace Engineering
mission: The purpose of Women in Aerospace Engineering (WAE) is to foster a community for gender minorities interested in aerospace engineering as well as encourage professional development and outreach through various social, industry, and local events.

name: Women in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
mission: Our mission is to empower female and non-binary EECS students to succeed by fostering community, offering mentorship opportunities, and hosting professional development events.

name: Women+ in Chemistry
mission: Women+ in Chemistry (WIC+) is a group that uses the lens of gender to guide its support of undergraduate students, graduate students and postdoctoral scholars in the Department of Chemistry. Our mission is to foster a sense of community in the department, facilitate connections with the greater community, support the professional development of department members, and advocate for people of all genders and for gender diversity in the department and the entire chemistry community.

name: Woop Garoo Magazine
mission: To write jokes.

name: Written Revolution
mission: Written Revolution is an anti-imperialist club dedicated to fostering a deeper understanding and critical analysis of imperialism's impact on societies, cultures, and economies worldwide. Our purpose is to engage and educate a broad audience through the power of conversations, written work, and advocacy.At the heart of Written Revolution is the belief that knowledge and awareness are foundational to fostering empathy, promoting social justice, and driving meaningful change. We aim to create a safe, inclusive space where individuals from diverse backgrounds can come together to learn, share, and discuss the complex histories and ongoing effects of imperialism in an expressive manner.While our main purpose is a monthly publication, our activities include organizing reading groups, writing workshops, guest lectures, and discussion forums focused on anti-imperialist literature, historical texts, and contemporary analyses. Through these initiatives, we seek to highlight the voices and stories of those affected by imperialism, challenge prevailing narratives, and encourage critical thinking among our members.

name: Wuming Theater Club
mission: The mission of Wuming is to promote expression of Chinese culture and language through the art of theater. We aim to provide important cultural and social bonding for participating diaspora Chinese students from diverse areas of the Sinophone world, and likewise to create a community among Chinese-speaking audience members while offering them satisfying theater-going experiences. Sharing Chinese culture with non-Chinese is also a part of the mission of Wuming. We include English subtitles in the shows to encourage an inclusive audience. By doing so, we enhance diversity in the MIT community.

name: Xapiens @ MIT
mission: To educate on and become involved in the advancement of radical technology which can lead to human enhancement

name: Yesplus at MIT
mission: The purpose of the Yesplus at MIT student group is to offer MIT students a lively and fun community to learn and practice meditation and other wellness activities. We organize yoga and meditation sessions.
